review_body: I stayed at the Moxy NYC Chelsea for a trip to NYC from California for work in early March. I was always curious about the Moxy brand also working at Marriott and the hotel lived up to my expectations of it being aimed towards Millenials (like myself) but also fitting the budget. The hotel itself was in the perfect location as it was a close walk to the subway stations and felt like a safe area. There's even a flower shop next door which is nice to walk out to in the morning. I absolutely loved the aesthetic of the hotel, and even the staff's uniform was so stylish! All the staff I encountered at the front desk were super friendly, including Maria and a few others I forgot the names of.The rooms are small but what do you expect in New York? You should also be minimally in the room and exploring anyhow! I stayed in a King room the first night and it was the first time I've seen a sink in the same area as the bedroom; I could see this as an issue if you are staying with someone and need to blowdry your hair while someone else is sleeping. However, this is not an issue in the double-bedded rooms so keep that in mind (the whole bathroom area is behind a closed-door versus in same room as the bedroom). Other than that, I loved the aesthetic and also loved how there was a steamer in the room. Another heads up, walls seem thin and I could constantly hear the neighbors talking or doors slamming in the hallway. The rooftop bar was also lovely! I went on a Saturday night and it was packed; expect long lines for the bar and pricey beverages. However, you can't beat the atmosphere and those views. I also visited the Moxy Times Square bar but I preferred how this one was much more classy.Overall, I really loved my stay at the Moxy NYC Chelsea and will absolutely recommend to anyone traveling to NYC. I'm dreaming about the next time I can return and stay there again!

The rooms are simple, but new and open with a lot of sunlight. The location is decent and centrally located. However, what made my stay enjoyable were the employees. Every single one of them was great and they always had smiles on their faces. Great customer service and they certainly ensured that my days got off to a good start. I will definitely be staying here again.

I’m no stranger to New York and I was really looking forward to this visit. I booked the Moxy Chelsea having read it was recommended for its fantastic views of the city and rooftop bar. Well it didn’t disappoint! We had a great view downtown from the 30th floor which we enjoyed waking up to and watching the city go by at night. The rooftop bar - Fleur Room was a nice treat too with some great views. The rooms were small, but just about the right size. Everything worked and we didn’t miss the extra space - very high quality. The location was good for getting around by subway with the 1-2-3 line stopping at 28th on the corner. The street is known as the flower district which was great to walk through on a sunny morning. I couldn’t recommend this hotel and it’s friendly staff more.

We enjoyed our stay at the Moxy Chelsea! We were visiting for my daughter’s 21st birthday and the hotel provided a great room on the 29th floor with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. They left balloons and decorated our window. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and accommodating. We ate at Feroce and it was delicious. We also went up to The Fleur Room for a great view of the city. We liked that the hotel was centrally located between Uptown and Downtown because we went all over. We also used the subway and the stop was just a block.

The location is great. The rooms are small, but are good for a quick stay. The lounges are really nice and the cocktails at happy hour were delicious!Mini fridge if you ask for one! Staff is super friendly and helpful. Will stay again!

Top notch experience start to finish. 3 college friends took a 3night 4 day trip to NYC. Starting with the reservations. We each booked separately using different methods and all got excellent rates and rooms ( booking.com, Amex travel, and hotels.com) . Before arriving, as I was somewhat hosting this get together, I inquired about getting an early checkin. I also requested a mini refrigerator,. There is no charge for that. You just have to request. They explained to me what to do to increase the likelihood of getting early check in. We had a very early morning flight and wished to change clothes and clean up a bit before heading out sightseeing. They made a note on each of our rooms that we would like early check in. I was told to call a number they gave me when we were in route from the airport. We did that and 2 of our rooms were ready early ( like 10:30 ish). There was a 3rd room available provided she switch from a king bed to 2 doubles which she did. The staff at the front desk was fantastic and check in was a breeze. When we were leaving they gave us clear concise information about our request related to taking the subway to the Brooklyn Bridge, including information on how to we could now use Apple Pay for the subway instead of needing a metro card. ( not all stations can do that yet). Our rooms..small and tight ( fine for 1 -2people)with amazing views. The design was really different than anyplace I’d been, but very efficiently laid out for use of space. My room had a king bed and the mini refrigerator arrived about 5 minutes after I got to the room. As you enter the bathroom is on yours right in a divided space with sliders like you might see on a double closet. One half has the commode and the other side is the shower. On the left as you enter is a full length mirror followed by a very modern sleek sink /vanity area with mirror above and open wrought shelving below that was stocked with towels and a blow dryer AND garment steamer. Ample plugs in the area for small appliances &/or phone. So probably the biggest difference from a typical hotel room was no closet or dressers or tables ( except 2 small night tables on both sides of bed). Attached the the wall was a pull down table/desk. Pretty cool. When you opened it on the back we’re fabric pockets for stuff like pens, phone , note pad , maybe even a tablet, and the table top is a good size. Plenty of room for a laptop and working papers beside, and again several outlets. A folding chair is hanging flush on one of the MANY pegs around the room. The pegs and provided hangers replaced a need for a closet. I actually loved this. I could put my outfits for the week including accessories on the pegs and visibly see them all laid out. I didn’t even bother with the hangers as the pegs were big enough ( subtle time saver hanging/unhanging ) . Not a big deal for most but I have a handicap with one hand and hanging clothes isn’t always simple for me. Under the bed are built ins that replace the need for dresser. Hanging on the peg is a foldout luggage table or you can store your luggage under the bed. I loved the efficient room features, including the many outlets and overall design. Easily worked for me. Now the food and drinks... every morning (7am-11am)free coffee on the 2nd floor ( no coffee maker in room). There is also a coffee shop at entrance to hotel with delicious coffee. Food looked good but I didn’t get to try any. There is a happy hour 5-7 with certain drinks being half price which is still expensive for this Florida girl. But this is NYC and I fully expected this. The drinks I tried each time were delicious and unique. I believe the Peroni beer was the happy hour beer the day we were there. The service was excellent. One night after a day of sightseeing we were to tired and just ate the tapas type food at the bar which was absolutely delicious, some chicken tenders type thing, an amazing grilled cheese type thing, truffle popcorn and these were not your normal versions of this stuff . I just can’t recall the other ingredients or sauce. We didn’t eat at the restaurant since we had dinner plans the other nights. It sure smelled good though whenever we were nearby. The rooftop bar was a lot of fun. Terrific views of the city all around, including getting to see the Empire State Building light show . It is an enclosed ( not open air garden type) bar. Monday not crowded at all. Tuesday night was rainy so it was definitely busier, but not bad. The crowd seemed to primarily be young to middle age professionals. The music was good but not so loud to make conversations difficult. We loved that we could just be at our hotel for after dinner socializing and just go to our room downstairs when we were ready to call it a night. A big reason for selecting this hotel. The other reason we selected this hotel is that we wanted to be in a different area of the city. In this case in the Chelsea area not far from Chelsea market and the High line. Walking distance to a lot of things and easy access to the subways. It is in the flower district and the flowers in the shops by the hotel are breathtaking. Location was perfect for us.

This was my second stay and both exceptionally pleasant from check in to the comfort of the rooms.I had the please of being welcomed by the amazing Danielle at the Front Desk who is just amazing and consistent with her high level of professionalism and genuine Customer Service.Look forward to another stay very soon.

We spent one week of blissful holidays with my wife in the 22nd floor of this awesome design gem in midtown Manhattan with an amazing view of the Empire State Building, extremely helpful staff and great facilities.

I travel to New York for work almost every month, and despite the fact that the rooms are a bit spartan, I keep coming back to the Moxy (and recommend it to colleagues and friends) because of Feroce bar and restaurant. Overall a great hotel for business travelers, groups of friends, young couples. Probably not a good fit for families with young children.

I absolutely love, love, love this hotel! The location is absolutely perfect, about a 4 block walk to subways connecting east and west. It's a small hotel but super clean and the service was just amazing, everyone was very friendly and responsive. The rooms are small, but that is to be expected in NYC, but what I love about this hotel is that every room seems to have natural sunlight and this is really important to me to have. Many NYC hotels you get stuck in a room looking at the side of another building. The rooftop bar has a great view of the Empire State Building. All in all, I love this hotel, I've stayed here twice and it will be my go-to from now on!

I usually stay at The Nomad, Edition Clocktower, or Soho House. This was a better stay than all three. Rooms have great natural light and comfortable beds.The hotel has great staff and amenities.If this hotel is available, BOOK IT.

So, I picked this hotel because location. Perfect. This hotel seemed to offer a lot as well and just seemed to fit the bill for the area. Upon check in, I was expecting a complimentary cocktail since they advertised (and still do) that it’s an amenity. We were told it was discontinued and didn’t bother to grandfather us into the rule. Ok. Then I had them my bags after they said our room was not ready, they don’t take our luggage! I had to go down to the basement, where it smelled of curry to take my luggage and store it myself. Finally got our room and omg. It was SMALL! It’s seriously goes from lobby: ok, decor kinda fun but strange. Then the hallways look like an industrial bowling ally. Then you get to your room that looks like it’s from a small cottage in northern Michigan. Camp for adults it felt. Yuck. And the staff pretty much make sure they have very little to no interaction as possible with you. Never again.

The room was "NYC Sized", but we were expecting that and it came with a spectacular view. Lots of funky little touches (vintage phone, interesting art) made the room feel fun. The bed was comfy. I wasn't a huge fan of the hook system in place of a closet and dresser.... where do you put things that don't go on hangers? Like underwear? We were staying for a few days so, a few drawers would have been nice.I unfortunately was under the weather, so I can tell you the channel selection on the TV is awesome. I watched a bunch of Showtime.The entrance seemed to always be under construction in one way or another but the lobby was efficient other than that. They don't seem to do early check in and the lounge area was PACKED with folks waiting for their rooms to be ready, At 4pm people started getting texts to check in. But the Lounge is lovely with natural light and fake plants.My Husband took advantage of roof top yoga and loved it.We both took advantage of the rooftop bar and it was fantastic. Fun spot, not too noisy or crowded. Very stylish.The restaurant next door does a great quick breakfast.

Normally a shower alone wouldn’t warrant a great review but the shower at Moxy Chelsea was next level, fully immersive, relaxing. While the room is on the smaller side (hello NYC), it’s well designed with spaces under the bed for storage, floor to ceiling windows to allow for brightness and a perception of space, and a beautiful ceramic full length sink that doubles as a shelf for your things. The hotels cool design and great location in the center of the city was a nice touch. But it’s the shower that really made the room standout. From the full coverage of the rainforest shower head to the large walk in tiled flooring to the fully enclosed space with an almost closet style sliding door, the shower turns into a steam room of sorts that allows for the experience to be fully immersive and relaxing. It was a great way to end a long day and kick start a new one.

My husband and I recently stayed at Moxy NYC Chelsea for a spontaneous overnight trip the the city. While the rooms are very small, the design of the space is perfect! It is modern, beautifully decorated and thoughtfully designed. We had everything we needed in our room including a great view! The hotel staff were all super friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, the rooftop bar was closed on the evening we stayed (Sunday) so we missed out on that, but we had a couple glasses of wine in the bar on the 2nd floor which was a very cool space and nice place to relax. The location of the hotel is also great for walking to local attractions like Chelsea Market, The Highline, Hudson Yards etc. We will definitely plan to stay at this hotel again on a future visit.

This hotel is on the gorgeous 28th St filled with flower shops. The shower is the best in Manhattan. All of the public spaces are great to satisfy any need whether it be a coffee, a quiet cozy corner, or a swanky cocktail with a view. The staff always goes above and beyond.

Our stay was incredible! Upon booking I called to request an early check in and the Empire State Building side of the hotel for our view. This trip to nyc was to celebrate a birthday, anniversary and Valentine’s Day.. when we checked in we were placed on the 33rd floor with a direct view of the Empire State Building. Our flight landed around 9:40am and we were able to check in by 12pm. The staff, atmosphere, and location of this hotel was unmatched for the area. We will be back and have already suggested Moxy of Chelsea to family for future NYC stays. Thank you for making this a trip to remember!

Our stay at Moxy NYC could have not been more perfect. The location is right off the Subway, walking distance to most key locations, and fully equipped to meet all of your needs. The rooms are small yet trendy, besides who is staying in the room anyway?! Hotel rooftop and lower level bars were amazing and the free coffee was also a hit.

I have now visited all of the Nyc Moxy locations. While we had a great time at the Time Square Moxy, and the East Village Moxy is convenient for visiting my family, the Chelsea Moxy was my first and continues to be my favorite. In chilly February, a doorway full of flowers greets me, as well as the happy and casual staff. No fuss, quick to settle in. My rooms view of the Empire State Building was glorious. I will stay here again and again.

Location in the flower district was very convenient to my meetings on 7th Avenue. Room was small but not cramped at all. No closet, but creative use of space in the room. The view from my window was outstanding!

My stay was outstanding!! Linda went out of her way to make sure I was given a room on the 33rd floor 3307 as I requested, I had a gorgeous view of the Empire State Building from my bed loved the beds and shower. Every turn you made staff had smiles and greeted me. This property is extremely well run, I had the pleasure of speaking with Anthony Reyes about his wonderful staff. I’d love to come back and try the Mondo Suite!! Thank you for an excellent first impression.

I was guest of this hotel for a full week.It's well positioned and just 10 min walking far from Madison Square Garder, Penn Station and 15 minutes from Time Square.My room was at 31th floor and I had an amazing view on Manhattan and Empire State Building from there.Very nice stay.

We stayed at the Moxy for a girls weekend in NYC. We had an early flight in from Florida and the staff was accommodating and got us into our room early. The food and cocktails in both the restaurant and bar were delish! The roof top bar is beautiful and the view is AMAZING!

This is a great place that doesn’t feel like a big cold NYC hotel. We stayed for a weekend and wished we could’ve stayed longer. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bar was fun and lively. And the location is perfect for something that’s not too touristy.

Nice modern and compact hotel bedroom. Very comfy and the view from it to NYC was awesome. Go up to the Fleur Room at the rooftop for great drinks and a crazy beautiful view of the Empire State Building.

Very good, clean and comfortable hotel in a central location - perfect for walking or metro. Had a slight issue which was unfortunately unresolved or managed with a client focused attitude. Having booked two "King View" rooms on a high floor with a request they were next to each other we were given one "King View" and one "King" - when questioned about this I was told rather bluntly they were the same room and the same size which they clearly were not, I questioned the answer and was told once again they were the same room - The photos on the Moxy Chelsea website clearly show the difference between the King and the King View including the size and layout of the rooms. The booking was made and paid through Hotel.com - not really sure what to do next? Other than this experience of dismissive bad attitude from 1 staff member, we had a great stay at the Moxy Chelsea New York.

Firs time staying at this property. Absolutely amazing and great atmosphere. The staff is super friendly and the food was delicious. Something for everyone. Went to the rooftop bar on Thursday night and the DJ was amazing!!! Plenty of room for dancing. Drinks were a little pricey.

Nice Hotel but disappointong room space for the Price. There’s no place to put your luggage. No closet, no room service, Poor amenities, contrast with the amazing view. For the same Price you May find more valuable options.

Great value and location. Rooftop bar a bit pretentious and pricey but great views. Some staff truly excellent, some less so. I have to write 200 characters minimum so here is some padding to achieve that.

We stayed for 3 nights at the Moxy in Chelsea. When we walked in to the hotel, we immediately loved all the decor and over all vibe of the hotel. Checkin was quick and easy. Customer service was great, but the rooms were AMAZING. We stayed on the 31st floor, and wow we loved everything about our room. The rooms were a good size for NYC standards. It was great lighting, both natural and artificial. The bathroom area was clean and bright. The bed was very comfortable. The view was amazing. The floor to ceiling windows are the best part of the room. We had the most amazing view of the city and the Empire state building. There are several restaurants in the hotel and even a rooftop club! The location was great. I have zero complaints about the hotel. We will certainly come back to NYC and stay the Moxy in Chelsea, we had such a great time!!

My stay at, The Moxy Hotel was wonderful. The room is small, but cozy. We had a great city view and the layout of the room was nice. The only two things I would critique are the room pillows and the partition sliding doors of the bathroom. The blurred glass on the bathroom doors still allow you to see a person’s silhouette while they’re using the restroom or shower. Other than that, I would recommend staying at The Moxy.

Recently stayed at this hotel. Great location and wonderful staff.Staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations.Would highly recommend this hotel for both business trips and weekend get-a-ways!

beautiful boutique hotel in the flower district of Chelsea- cool vibe, lovely 2nd floor bar and pizza oven.Rooftop bar. Great location. Awesome value! Got a great deal thru Travelzoo. Would stay here again!

The Moxy was a nice surprise. A hidden gem in NYC. I will definitely stay again. We had drinks up at the Fleur on the Rooftop before we headed out for dinner and then came back and had after dinner drinks at the Bar on the second floor. Good drinks, nice atmosphere. We completed our stay with a lovely breakfast downstairs in the café. We went to a spa day a few blocks away on Friday and that is why we chose the Moxy.

I stayed here four nights on business. I arrived late at night to a friendly greeting and quick check in. my room was only on the 6th floor, so not much of a view, but it goes up to 30-something floors, so if you ask or have Marriott status, you might do better.There's a couple of restaurant options in/attached to the hotel, and a cool rooftop bar as well. My room was small, but well laid out, and I didn't feel cramped. Good shower with a super simple one-knob operation (not like those unlabelled three-knob ones that take an engineering degree to decipher).With my jetlag I enjoyed the 7am free drip coffee (6am would be better!) in the lounge on the second floor.I'll be back!

This was my first stay at a Moxy hotel and I have since also visited their Times Square location. I was in town for a quick overnight stay while I went to a special concert at Webster Hall. I booked my stay last minute based on its location near Penn Station and subway lines. I was so pleasantly surprised when I checked in! The front flower shop was adorable, and very bright and welcoming on the dreary day when I arrived. The lobby was modern and chic and the check-in process as well as luggage storage was very easy. One of the most outstanding parts of my stay was the service provided by every employee I interacted with at Moxy NYC Chelsea. They were all helpful, friendly, and kind. The decor was fantastic as well, my room was comfortable and cozy with a nice view. I adore the bathroom finishes so much, I recently inquired to have similar ones put in my home. There was one small hiccup when the fire alarms in the building went off late at night, causing the whole building to evacuate, but the situation was handled very well by staff and it was remedied quickly. I do have to say, it was quite funny to see hotel guests in their PJ's mingling with dressed-up bar goers on the sidewalk outside of the hotel! I had an amazing stay and really can't wait for my next visit!

I'm sorry, there are some nice rooftops around it but it is the best. Absolutely gorgeous decor, great service and spectacular views. This is a go to place if you have out of town visitors. Still unknown because it is relatively new but well worth the visit. Pricey but worth it. Go here, you won't regret it

There is nothing quite like cozy and this certainly was in a very modern, minimalist kind of way.Nothing negative to say. The rooms are well appointed - just super small.However the location was great and the price was excellent ($0 using my accumulated points). Walking distance from everything a tourist needs, including Macy's.

Moxy Chelsea is one of a new breed of hotels with trendy, contemporary design and a re-imagining of where to allocate precious NYC space in rooms and public spaces. Moxy (from Marriott) seems to have the formula down, but it's important to note what works well, and what doesn't (for families, at least--- perhaps we're not the target demographic, but it's still a good option for all kinds of travelers.)The rooms are small but well designed. Also, the hotel is new, so that helps--- I'm not so sure some of the design details are durable enough to age well, but we'll see. (Our shower leaked into the toilet area every day, but we jammed extra towels at the bottom and it worked fine to prevent water from spreading.) I think one of the draws is that it seems like the vast majority of rooms have great views. It's something like 35 stories, with decent air space around it, so I think almost everyone gets something. We were in an 8th floor room--- the quad bed bunk rooms only go from 4th to 12th floor, something we didn't know in advance--- but still, it had a nice sliver of a view of the Empire State Building. I'd want to be in the 20's if I had my choice of floors.The location was fantastic for us. Moxy is on a small, flower district street along with Hyatt House, Hilton Garden Inn, Cambria Hotel, and Hotel Hayden. The street is relatively quiet, and Moxy's new construction made it even quieter. Though only on the 8th floor, we rarely heard any street noise except when we opened our window (yes! it opens!). It's also a treat to have plants and flowers lining almost the entire block. There were multiple 28th Street options for subway stations depending on where we were headed. And we also walked everywhere to eat, from Flatiron (Eataly!) to Gramercy Park/Union Square, to Tribeca. Super convenient.The hotel has its quirks. Not a lot of service around. When we needed it, we were able to get attention and service, but there's just not a lot of staff around. There is no lobby to speak of. I like lounging in hotel lobbies, especially when waiting for the rest of my family, but there's really nowhere to wait here except the 2nd floor, which is sort of removed from the entrance and gets a night-clubby vibe in the evenings and night. That vibe is ever present from the ridiculously dark, black-painted elevator lobby to the elevators themselves, with it's black button panel that had more than one person shining their iPhone on to see which floor to push. Just silly--- contemporary style doesn't have to be this difficult.The silliness extends to the stunning "rooftop" sky lounge (aka, Fleur Room) which is inexplicably only open in the evenings into the wee hours of the morning. In other words, it's operated as a "club" accessible to 21+ guests and other trend-seekers off the street. So my kids couldn't even visit the lounge to check out the incredible views of the Empire State Building and NYC skyline. I asked the front desk for 5 minutes so my kids to see it, but they replied that the space was operated by a promoter so they had no discretion to let anyone visit the space.So Moxy has that nightclub side to it, for better or worse, but it's still a place I'd stay again. The rooms, while small, are thoughtfully designed. Our room had four beds (two bunk beds) that enabled our kids to have some private space. It worked. All the hooks/knobs to hang things were essential; there was just enough space for the four of us on a six-night stay. I'd prefer having some extra space to sit, or write at a desk, but we did just fine without it. The room rates are a bargain for what you get. It's quiet, the mattresses are excellent, and the place is super clean. Housekeeping was very good.The gym was small but seemed sufficient for this size hotel. It was never crowded. There's also a small business center where I printed some show tickets without issue. Moxy Chelsea provides a lot of value in a clean, quiet, and well-designed setting. Sure, I'm not a fan of the nightclub feel, but other than that it's an excellent choice for a midtown hotel. Highly recommended.

Small rooms. Had a room with king bed with an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Really just good for 1 person. Busy bar on the second floor. Excellent lounge on the 35th floor with fantastic views of NYC. 4 stars because the rooms were just so small but otherwise functional.

We can’t thank the staff of the Moxy more for all of their professional and courteous care. The rooms were all clean. They were attentive and informative. My son left his phone upstairs in the rooftop bar and the manager and staff made calls and sent emails and got it back for him while the place was closed. I can’t thank them enough as my son has a business and needed his phone. Quick and top notch care was taken in this situation and we can‘t thank them enough. We will highly recommend this location.

We stayed at The Moxy for 4 nights whilst in New York. The hotel is amazing, really nice clean and tidy rooms, great views and really helpful friendly staff. Rooms were cleaned everyday and we had everything we needed. I would 100% recommend staying at The Moxy if visiting, within walking distance of lots of attractions and subway.

I honestly don’t normally rave about hotels but this place was one of the best places I’ve stayed so far. Every single staff member made my mums birthday a trip she will never forget. Little details from the balloons in the room to the messages on the mirror gave it such a personal touch.All the hotel bars are amazing and Fleur Room on the rooftop is a must see for a great Manhattan view. Really easily accessible via Uber or Subway but we walked everywhere most of the time. I’d say about 12 min walk from Times Square (feels less) and 3 mins from MSG. The beds are soooo comfortable we really didn’t want to leave!Thank you to the management at the hotel, best NYE decision ever!

Amazingly gorgeous stay at Moxy Chelsea!! My boyfriend and I wanted to go on a small weekend trip together and as soon as I saw the intricate charm of this spot I was instantly ready to book our trip! Everything was absolutely gorgeous from the design of our room to the floral aesthetics of the bars and lounge areas. We look forward to coming back for another weekend trip ASAP and hopefully exploring the other Moxy hotels as well!

4 of us spent 1 night in 1 room with 2 beds. This is an overall excellent hotel in the Flower district. For anyone considering a stay here, you have to undertstand that the rooms are for sleeping only. They are very small and the only furniture besides beds are the table and chair that hang on the wall. The bathroom is seperated from the main room by a smoked glass door making privacy difficult. However the hotel is beautiful, the staff is great and the rooms look brand new. The roof top bar is amazing and you should come just to look at the amazing views of the city. I would definitely stay here again

Great hotel, clean, efficient and good vibes. One of the best rooftop bars in NYC! Staff is super helpful and genuinely nice. Rooms are very comfortable and clean, much better than most hotels. Will definitely come back.

I took my two oldest boys (22 and 19) on a trip to NYC for the week of New Years Eve and we had a fantastic time! From check-in to departure, everyone at the Moxy was incredibly helpful and pleasant to deal with! The hotel is beautiful and it was a place we very much enjoyed coming back to at the end of a long day. We attempted to do the Times Square thing for NYE and that was a little more than what we wanted to deal with so we decided to come back to the Moxy and figure out how we wanted to spend NYE. They had a really nice NYE party happening on the 2nd floor with a DJ so we decided to get dressed and attend that. I’m glad we did! It was a lively party with great drinks and friendly people all around and it was a perfect way to ring in the new year! We stayed in a quad bunk room which was PERFECT for our situation. My boys don’t like sleeping with each other and I don’t like sleeping with them either - LOL so each of us having our own, ridiculously comfortable bed was really ideal. We had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building from our room. The room was small but somehow they put it together so efficiently that it seemed very roomy! They don’t waste space at the Moxy. Whoever space planned this place is a genius! The mattresses were incredible, the sheets and comforters were plush and comfortable and the linens were top notch. The rain head shower head made it hard to take a quick shower because you want to stay underneath it all day! The area that the hotel is in is ideal. The 1 train is at the end of the block which makes it super easy to get just about anywhere. There is a Dunkin Donuts right across the street - my fave coffee spot in the morning (although the hotel does offer free coffee at the 2nd floor bar from I think 7am - 11am. The lobby and the whole hotel for that matter smells clean and inviting. I can go on and on about how wonderful our stay was. We couldn’t have enjoyed the hotel more! If there was one thing I’d change, it’s the location of the tv in the room. We were hardly in the room as we stayed out just about all day but when we were in the room, the tv was hard to watch from the top bunks. It’s mounted on the wall just below the long row of hanging hooks which doesn’t make a whole lot of sense because you are pretty much unable to use the hooks above the tv because whatever’s hanging there will cover the tv. If the tv was mounted above the hooks, you’d still be able to see it from the bottom bunks, you’d be able to see it much better from the top bunks and you’d also not have a section of useless hooks above the tv. Again, wonderful hotel with wonderful staff in a wonderful neighborhood. We’ll definitely be back some day and we’re already counting down the days!

We stayed at the Moxy Chelsea for two nights, ending on Christmas Eve and it was GREAT! We had made a reservation at a hotel in Times Square for 2 adults and three kids under 14. They wanted us to stay in two separate rooms that were not even adjoining! I called up the Moxy and they hooked us up with two cool adjoining rooms. This place is so new and hip and all the staff were incredible. Don't miss the 4 season rooftop restaurant or the 2nd floor pizza oven. Great Italian place just off the lobby, Feroce, for coffee in the morning and amazing dining in the evening!

My room at the new Moxy Hotel Chelsea was one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in (and I have stayed in some small rooms in Europe and Asia). There are no closets in the room, but rather a generous amount of clothing hooks along one wall. There is no work desk or station either, but a folding "bistro" style table and a single folding chair. But, mostly because the hotel is fairly new, the room was spotlessly clean and in great condition. The staff was very friendly and greeted me with goodbyes and hellos when I came and went. If you're not going to be staying in your room for great lengths of time, or if you're traveling solo, I can recommend the Moxy for clean, well maintained rooms in a great location.

Loved how cute and festive this hotel was for NYE. The staff was super friendly and helpful in answering all of our questions. The rooms were the perfect size and had a great view of the city. Had an overall great time and will definitely be back soon.

The hotel was lovely and the staff was exceptional. They were very friendly, did not fail to greet us every time we entered the building and all the staff, regardless of position, were eager to help us with anything. I found the simplistic approach very comfortable. The room was very adequate in size for 1. May have been a bit tight for 2 as I used all the space and had to keep my luggage on the other side of the bed. The location a=was perfect. We could walk almost everywhere from the neighborhood. My room looked directly at the Empire State Building which was so close, it felt like I could touch it. Roof top bar was a beautiful experience. Look forward to a return visit.

We travel to NYC for the Holidays each year now (16th year this year) and always stay in Chelsea--our first time at Moxy NYC Chelsea will NOT be our last! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return here (for many reasons)--highly recommend!

We stayed here recently and the accommodation was average, but as expected in this very expensive city. As this is a large building with many rooms, there is not much interaction with guests. Rooms are very small and do nit have any coffee/tea making facilities, which is standard with most accommodation worldwide. Service staff were friendly and helpful when required. Shower sliding door was difficult to open and close. We had great views and light show from the Empire State Building. Good location within walking distance to main city area.

This is a great property. My wife, daughter and I stayed here a week before Christmas. The location is ideal because it is a 30-minutes walk to most places - Chelsea Market, Times Square, High Line - or go anywhere from the 28th Street Metro line at the end of the block. Also, it is located in the flower district. That’s very nice. Step outside and walk past fresh flowers, evergreen trees and other plants. Beautiful! And Feroce is a wonderful place to have breakfast.If you’re looking for a place to stay, look no further and book now!

This place is a gem, no wonder it gets all the hypes. I enjoyed it a lot with my stay. Pro: brand new hotel, super cute and chic, and instagram worthy. The rooms are modern and clean. Beds are comfy. The bars are super cute, the rooftop is the place to be on weekends. People are very nice, good service. Great location, It’s very close to the metro. Con: yes the rooms are small and it doesn’t have everything like a normal hotel does. But it’s very functional. Maybe not a great idea for family with younger kids.

This hotel was great and the rooftop bar was a fun location to hang out. The rooms are very small. The interior decor was very trendy and well put together. The style of hotel was similar to an Ace Hotel and maybe not ideal for families.

Had an amazing stay in this wonderful hotel, can’t rate it enough! The staff are wonderful, the rooms are beautifully decorated and then the views over midtown are to die for! Couldn’t recommend enough!!

I just had a very nice stay at the Moxy-Chelsea in the Flower District of Manhattan. It's very well located near Penn Station, Times Square, the Rubin and Fashion Institute on Technology Museums, the High Line, Elmo's and numerous others NYC jewels. I found the front desk staff very pleasant and competent and everything in the room was unique pleasing, and in order. I loved the city (and water) views from my 21st floor room, the second floor restaurant (with a wood fired pizza oven) and bar (with prosecco for $8 during happy hour and a token for a free glass on your day of arrival). The comfort of the room, though small, was quite cozy. The ambiance was soulful, with the tiles in the shower spelling "Wander", and the tiles in the water closet spelling "Lust". How fun is that? The TV worked very well and I was able to watch Netflix and had great internet connectivity.

- Scam charged for items we didn’t consume after checking out, $5 per tiny water bottle. We purposely bought our own water at the local Walgreens.- Concierge phoned wrong room in the middle the night which woke us both up for no reason.- Luggage storage is in the cellar and you have to lug your own bags down there in a service elevator that is possibly the slowest in NY… Good luck getting back up to the ground floor.- Smallest hotel lobby with very bad layout, also the staff of the hotel constantly overcrowded the guest elevators- Tiny deceiving rooms with bad views, don’t bother paying extra for “city view” like we did, save your money and stay elsewhere- Also the rooms get full of condensation because they are so small, so you wouldn't be seeing anything out the window regardless.- AVOID

We had the pleasure of staying at the Moxy Chelsea in early December. The hotel was ideally located, close to transport links and nestled close to a number of landmarks.Check in was easy with friendly and helpful staff. We received complimentary ‘bubbles’ at the bar which was a lovely touch.I’d contacted the hotel in the weeks before our trip to tell them about a special occasion and the fabulous team upgraded us to a room with the most breathtaking view of Empire State. It was truly stunning. In addition, they went out of their way to ensure our special night was memorable and I cannot thank the hotel enough for giving us some amazing memories.The rooms and compact, but are ideal for those visiting to explore NYC. The beds are comfortable and as mentioned before, the view from our room was nothing short of breathtaking.The bar on level 1 had a great atmosphere and the hotel staff were happy to help.A billing error occurred when we got home, with us being double charged for our stay, which was somewhat of a shock to see. However the team there processed a refund as soon as we pointed out the error.We can’t recommend the hotel highly enough, and very much look forward to returning one day.

My overall opinion of my stay at the Moxy Chelsea is ......not great, not bad, it’s just okayFront Desk Staff - nobody went out of their way to ensure we were enjoying our stay or offered even the slightest smile when interacting with us. Everyone seemed overwhelmed or just not interested in being the face of the hotel . Room ( king bed ) - perfect for solo travelers with very little luggage. In my opinion it’s way too small for 2+ people with any luggage larger than carry on sizes. There is no storage for cloths , only hooks to hang your cloths and the hooks are attached to the walls of the room. 2nd Floor Bar - the best group of employees in the entire building are working at this bar. Specifically Christian who make excellent drinks. Roof top bar- unfortunately it was closed on the first night and too busy the second night for us to make it up. Elevators - super slow in peak times . Plan accordingly . Give yourself extra time getting to the lobby. Ambiance - not as refined as the pictures look online and they are going for a younger , hip crowd with the decor. Location - love the location! The neighborhood is great and you have quick access to taxis, subway and if you don’t mind walking plenty of places just south to eat and drink. As a Marriot Member I did not receive any of the preferences in my profile.

Fantastic hotel great location lovely reception staff rooms very nice (little small for 4) but overall great stay. 10min walk to time square 4mins to madison square gardens.. free coffee in the morning a nice touch

Great location and views. Fairly small rooms but who spends all their time in a hotel room when you're in NY? Its roof top bar has amazing views and the staff are all very good and professional. I'd of liked a coffee machine in my room for a morning cuppa but thats a small gripe really.

Stayed here for four nights and enjoyed it a lot! Yes, the rooms are a little tiny but thats what you get in NYC and Moxy. The room itself was beautiful and had everyhting needed. The views had been very decent too! Make sure to get a high floor! Staff was really nice especially Danielle from front desk. the location is just perfect and they have a good bar and restaurant too. Very positive stay!

The wonderful and wonderfully sweet Mister Marvin at the front desk made our trip complete. He was a friendly and refreshing face upon our return to the hotel every day.The restaurant was NOT as accommodating as it should have been during our breakfast.

Although I had booked well in advance when we checked in early in the afternoon we were told our room type was not available (a two bedded room) for 3 - couple and child. We were offered 2 adjacent rooms (not interconnected) as the only option - not ideal and when I explained this to the staff they couldn’t fix the issue but they did compensate by reversing the charge for the night until our room type was available the following day. No room to unpack anyway! Very contemporary and clean rooms with funky styling. I liked!The staff were pleasant and the in-house restaurant was lovely (Ferroce). Even more beautiful was the rooftop bar which had the best view of the city at night from 35th floor. Beautifully appointed and great cocktails ( but note “guest list” as in nightclub entry) only after 9pm. Nice breakfast in bar - but not enough seating for guests...standing room only! WeirdGreat location for Macy’s and centrally locates for downtown and walking everywhere.

We chose the Moxy Chelsea for our annual girls trip to NYC. It did not disappoint. The attention to detail was incredible. Beautiful spaces for dinner, coffee & night time entertainment. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful recommending delicious restaurants within walking distance. The rooms, although small were adorable with beautiful views. We will be back!

I was lucky enough to connect with Danielle (Front Desk) who helped me create a special moment and sweet delivery for a friend staying at the hotel. She was not only helpful, but so very kind and went far out of her way to make sure our surprise was perfect. She’s an absolute treasure for the Moxy brand experience and has turned me into a BIG fan of the hotel.

This was a very uncomfortable stay for us. The guest rooms are the size of a basic bedroom in a modest home but with no furniture. There is no closet to hang your dresses or suit coats. There are no drawers to empty your luggage in, there isn’t even a luggage rack to set your suitcase on but just as well because there would be no room for it. The rooms are so tiny and cramped that you are provided with a folding table and one chair that is hanging on the wall. No frills, no robe, make up mirror, just a basic bedroom. We asked for a bigger room and were told “they’re all the same size.” This little room is great for a one-night stand because you wouldn’t have room for a suitcase. The walls must be made of paper mâché because you can hear everything above you and next door. If you prefer a more spacious room for your stay, I don’t recommend this hotel. We don’t plan on staying here again. On the positive, it is a great spot to eat or enjoy NYC nightlife but the focus isn’t on their rooms.

Visited the city for the weekend and had a blast. Every staff member at the hotel was very friendly. The rooftop bar had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Great location near Penn and a quick trip to China Town,Little Italy and the Village.

Spent Thanksgiving in NYC with family and booked directly with the Moxy Chelsea fairly late. Got an excellent and very reasonable rate, and somehow, a view of the Empire State Building from our room! The hotel is located on 28th, just before 6th Ave - fantastic central location, a hearbeat from every form of transportation. The rooms are small (with minimal storage) but well designed with huge windows. The separation of toilet/shower/sink is brilliant and works perfectly. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and we slept like logs. Most important to me as I am a light sleeper, we heard zero noise from any other room, either adjacent or above us - can't say I have ever had this experience in NYC. Perhaps this is due to the solid concrete construction of every part of this hotel.(There is of course, some street noise). In terms of amenities, this hotel also knocked it out of the park for us, with 3 different restaurants - all very nice, super bar, a roof top lounge (separate managment), a gym, luggage storage and then just myriad spaces for working or conversations. The Conservatory space on the south side is just lovely. All the staff was extremely polite and helpful. Seriously, there is so much to love about this hotel - we thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay. We will definitely be coming to the Moxy Chelsea, every time we come up to NYC.

We had originally planned to stay in a different hotel nearby but on arrival it was being renovated and looked like a construction site. We arrived then at Moxy and they got us a fantastic room with an incredible view of the Empire State Building, they were so accommodating and gave us extra free drinks for our troubles and continued to go above and beyond for all our needs. Highly recommend and ask for an Empire State view (it won’t disappoint)! The girls on reception also gave great food recommendations so ask if you aren’t sure.

From start to finish the stay was first class. The staff were amazing and I loved the room. Amazing views of that perfect NYC skyline. Stayed for work and it was just no nonsense and everything so quick like extra pillows & towels.

What a mixed bag. Definitely visually appealing, no doubt about that. Also a good service recovery experience (although too bad I had to find out...)The room: folks aren't kidding when they say it is small. I am glad I am staying here alone, and for only one night, and even that feels cramped. I'm pretty tidy and have only a carry-on; there is stuff EVERYWHERE! No closet and nowhere to put your suitcase. There is what appears to be a table and folding chair hanging up but I can't imagine where in the world you are supposed to put them. Not complaints, more of just observation. Also the bathroom privacy is rapidly approaching ZERO; I would never stay here with more than one person in the room even if it is someone you are close to.I had called the hotel a few hours prior to arrival to inquire about room service or carry-out. (Flight very delayed, tired, maybe just want to get some food and go to bed.) This is when I started to wonder about the hotel... I'd tried the "chat" function on Marriott Bonvoy app a few times, not working. I called the hotel and pressed 2 for dining. It rang, and rang, and rang. I called back and pressed 5 for "anything else" and spoke to a young lady who informed me about the lack of room service and told me that carry out was only allowed from one of the restaurants, Le Fleur. I asked where to find a menu (as there wasn't one on the app and I wanted to perhaps call an order in ahead of time.) She said to check the webpage. There isn't a menu on the webpage because LE FLEUR IS A NIGHTCLUB. (Also they are closed on Sundays which was the day of the week I was here.) Hmm, sounds like she did not know what she was talking about.Check-in experience was fine. Went to the pizza/bar area on 2nd floor. Wanted to sit at a bar as traveling alone. Inquired if pizza was served in the bar and the hostess told me that "I know it sounds weird but the way you do it here is you order the pizza to go and then you take it to the bar..." OK, she answered quick enough and confidently enough that clearly this is asked a lot. So I ordered a pizza and went to the bar to get a seat and tell them my plans. Then they politely informed me that it is not allowed... they grabbed a manager (why? I don't know. Either it is allowed or it is not; I don't want a special exception or to break the rules.) He was also polite and offered to make a one time exception but I was told that the "brands" of the pizza and bar were separate. I don't want to be "that person" so I left and cancelled the pizza order. But why is one person telling me to do something directly in opposition to the other? (The pizza and bar are basically across from each other, direct line of sight.)So I went downstairs, told the front desk the story so they could perhaps help advise the restaurant staff better for next time, and went to the restaurant.This was the first good thing that happened. I'll leave a separate review when I have time, but suffice to say the time-honored tradition of solo hotel guests dining solo at a bar was in full force. The front desk offered me a credit toward my meal for my trouble (which was very kind) and I ended up enjoying the evening.At 0715 the "7am" coffee service was just being set up by a surly young man who refused to even return my "good morning". When I let him know the half and half (sitting next to the coffee pot) was empty he curtly responded "that's because I haven't had time to fill it up yet." I travel to this area fairly frequently but will probably not be returning to this hotel. Maybe they are just too new to have gotten their ducks in a row, but I am not sure I want to find out.

I visit NYC often and usually stay in boutique hotels. In all honesty I wasn’t expecting to love the Moxy Chelsea, but I was pleasantly surprised! Spacious room with a great view, personality and cute details, friendly staff, great location and great amenities. Would certainly recommend and will be back myself!

The hotel is modern and stylish. Almost all NYC hotels don't have enough elevators and you can spend a lot of time waiting to go up or down; this building is new and is better provisioned. The rooms are small, but they are well-lit and have great views over the city. The best thing about this hotel, however, is the bar up on the 35th floor which has sweeping views and great cocktails. It was far from being crowded on Friday night and it's a great place for a drink to begin or end your evening in the city.

Great hotel, great location, friendly staff, nice common areas.Nice lounge to enjoy in the evening. Pizza cafe smelled amazing but did not have a chance to eat there - will definitely do next time. Amazing views if you can get a city view room.

Absolutely loved our stay with Moxy Chelsea. We had a King City View - it was spectacular. The room was clean, the sheets were SO soft, and the view was worth every penny. The location was great, too! Couldn’t recommend Moxy Chelsea enough.

I stayed here just one night but was very impressed. Check in was late, after midnight, but staff was wide awake and very welcoming. The room design is very interesting. The sink in the main living area is a bit awkward but stylish. The shower is nice and large and easy to operate. I had a rear facing room but still a great view of the Empire State Building. The bed was large and comfortable. HVAC was a little noisy but still managed a good sleep. Room was on the smallish side but plenty of space for one or cozy for two.

The room was well decorated, very modern and functional. The location was perfect for walking to lots of restaurants and sightseeing. Staff was friendly and helpful, and views of the city were great!!

For a nearly brand new hotel the staff and amenities were on point. And for a NYC hotel in a business part of the city my stay was comfortable and quiet. I highly recommend this hotel for any purpose of a visit to NYC.

If you're traveling for business in NYC, the Moxy Chelsea is an excellent choice. Convenient location, excellent bar and restaurant, friendly staff, and everything looks new. The rooms are small, but that comes with the territory.

It was my first time using my Marriott employee discount and my stay was nothing short of amazing. Everyone was warm and very nice. The complimentary Prosecco added a touch to our stay. I wish I would’ve remembered everyone’s names but our server on the rooftop was great and the manager (Amy?) was great as well. Thank you, we will be returning!

AMAZING, TRENDY HOTEL! A large group of us recently stayed at the MOXY Chelsea for a work trip. Safe to say everyone really enjoyed their stay and the hotel definitely surpassed our expectations. Most of our rooms all had amazing views of the Empire State Building. So cool seeing it all lit up at night!! The rooms are very well designed & the amenities outside the rooms are NEXT LEVEL. The rooftop bar is probably the most trendy bar in NYC right now. Amazing views & even better atmosphere & drinks! There are also so many great & collaborative work spaces for both small & large groups. Or if you're flying solo, the second floor is a great spot to plug-in and get your work done. We partnered with Christian P. who was absolutely amazing to work with and very accommodating with our groups needs. He made the entire booking process so easy for a large group and was always quick to respond when we needed to make changes. We will definitely be back to NYC next year and can confidently say we'll be staying at the MOXY Chelsea again. Highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a cool place to stay in NYC. They're also very accommodating for any families traveling with kids.

Overall great hotel. Every thing is brand new and the team is awesome. Danny was able to answer questions about the area and make a reservation for me. The rooms were small but they were modern and fun. The bar is awesome! I would stay here again!

This hotel is in a great location to get to MSG, Chelsea, Flatiron, etc., great spaces to work, grab complimentary coffee in the morning and they have meditation every Wednesday. Rooms are cozy but well appointed with decor and modern touches. Definitely will stay again!

Overpriced small rooms with lousy service coffee was terrible pizza was overpriced rooftop bar was cool but workers not friendly asked for ice 3 times Finally gave up and just left will not be returning

This hotel is a real hidden gem! Super cute and modern with excellent friendly service. The view of the New York skyline from my room on the 31st floor was outstanding. They also have some great little touches like a free glass of Prosecco at the hotel’s trendy bar for guests. Really close to the subway and Penn Station/Madison Square Garden which was super handy. Would definitely stay again!

Our stay at the Moxy Chelsea was wonderful! The location was perfect and convenient to get around town easily. The view of the Empire State Building from our room was spectacular! The rooms were very nice, clean and hotel staff was extremely helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City and plan to return again ourselves!

Everything about the hotel was terrific and completely different than any hotel I have stayed in. Bed was great showers top notch and the view of The Empire State building looked as if I could touch it. The bar was hip and the bocce ball was alot of fun. The staff made us feel very welcome and look forward to coming back and staying again.

We had drinks and pizza in the restaurant. Drinks were well made and the pizza was awesome! Friendly staff and a "brick pizza oven". After snacks we went upstairs to the rooftop bar. The views are AWESOME! Very urban feel and comfortable. You can sit at the bar or find a private place in comfy chairs.

Small room but well appointed and had everything you need. Layout worked and was good for two people. Nice bar areas and a small pizza restaurant on site. Convenient too many local attractions and set in the flower district.

Very good location in Chelsea, perfect room, small but well equipped and astonishing views. Very helpful staff in the hotel and in the restaurant. Very easy check-in and check-out. Will come back another time no doubts.

This was my second visit to Moxy Chelsea--- the staff was SUPER friendly from the "welcome" - Genuinely Friendly! The room was once again SUPER clean / neat / convenient. I had a great dinner in the second floor restaurant (great menu and drink selections). I love the creativity of the room layout / technology access as well. Also i visited the gym and it had all I needed for a short trip...You guys go this right !!! I will be back for business and personal travel to NYC!

I travel every week, and I think they nailed it for price, atmosphere, and community space. The rooms are small, but they made sure to have the two most important elements, a good shower and a comfortable bed. It forces you to work outside your room, which is nice, as you get the full NY vibe, versus staying locked up in some dingy hotel room. I love their look and feel. If you are traveling w/ more than 1, it may be tough b/c of space, but as 1 person, it is perfect!!!

I stayed with my 13 year old daughter for 5 nights. The bed was huge and really comfortable. Powerful shower with plentiful hot water. Our room was on 18th floor with excellent views of the Empire State Building. Very convenient situation, metro stop at the end of the road and walkable to most places. Because we don’t really travel light I took a number of hangers with us, this was useful as only 4 are provided. No iron but a great little hand held steamer that did the job, no problem. Free morning coffee on 2nd Floor and a convenient luggage storage area. The lifts were quick, just a bit difficult to read the floor numbers as the lifts are quite dark (probably to do with the ambiance of the hotel!) Enjoyed our stay, thank you Moxy!

My wife and I had an amazing stay at the Moxy Chelsea last weekend. Really cool hotel with a great location, service and views! I'd recommend a drink on the rooftop during sunset. We will definitely be back.

The moxy Chelsea is in a wonderful location, the hotel is beautifully decorated and while rooms are small the layout is optimal. We were in a double double and there was more than enough room for 2 people to move around! The WiFi was fast, free coffee on 2nd floor was an added bonus. The service was flawless!

The view is gorgeous, but the room is tiny and lacks certain facilities (such as wardrobes, room service, ...). We enjoyed the view, but wouldn't recommend this for a long stay. The rooftop bar is indoors only unfortunately. The staff was very friendly and professional.

This hotel was a great option--close to my office when visiting from out of town but not compromising on experience & design. I am a designer and I loved discovering new details and spaces throughout the property. One of my favorite Moxy locations by far!

It was my first time visiting NYC and I chose this hotel for its location. I found it very easy to either bike or walk almost everywhere. From Times Square to the Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel is on a street that is lined with flowers. There are wholesale floral shops along the street. The room was very clean and efficient. There was only two of us, I personally can’t image 4 in the room. There are no bureaus at all just some pegs on the wall and 2 drawers under the bed. The bathroom is small as well but very clean. It worked perfect for us. There is free coffee on the second floor which is a bar later in the day. There is also a roof top bar.

The location in the garden district gives you the opportunity to visit all the famous spots in New York. Walking distance from Penn station, so you can use the subway from te airport to get to your hotel.The hotel is new and has a modern twist. The small "Manhattan" rooms are designed in a way that you have plenty of room.great breakfast and pretty affordable for a Manhattan hotel.The hotel is situated in the garden district, a lovely area with some nice restaurants.

I stayed here for the weekend with some friends and we were pleasantly surprised with the quality and style of the hotel for the price we paid. The rooms are small, expected for Manhattan, but make the most of the space. It’s a great central location if you’re using Penn Station and there are plenty of subway stops nearby. We only visited the cafe on the first floor to get coffee and croissants- overpriced but fine for breakfast on the go. The lobby is lovely with the flower shop right in front. I’d definitely stay here again.

This is such a beautiful hotel with the perfect location. Being in the flower district is so lovely! Loved the room - beautifully designed and super comfortable. The hotel is a great spot for hanging with friends too. Highly recommend.

Good location, clean and stylish room. I didn’t appreciate the pressure at check out to give 5 starts on TripAdvisor.Why does this review have to be 200 characters minimum? Ridiculous sjehdnnehsbnsnsjsjsj

This is our second time staying at a Moxy property. First property was in Paris. Paris property had a very young, trendy vide. Which is what I expected for the Chelsea location. I have to say this property exceeded my expectations, definitely different from the Paris location. The decor, the rooms, the vibe, the service was exceptional! We were fortunate enough to experience all the perks that this property offer, such as coffee on the second floor bar. Drinks/food at the second floor bar, the pizza bar was excellent! We were seated right away and service was phenomenal. The Fleur bar upstairs on the 35th floor with it's amazing view of the empire State building.As someone who travels to NYC occasionally, we definitely plan to stay here again! Officially one of my favorite property!

Well located and well appointed spot in Chelsea. Comfortable room with the basics. Great bar that is convenient for for a pre- or post-dinner cocktail. Will be happy to stay again the next time we travel to NYC.

I stayed at the Moxy hotel for a week. This hotel is very different to your usual Marriott, you like something cool and funky, this is it. You won’t be wowed by the small rooms or tight spaces, but if you like something fun, then stay here. Check-in was easy, they are very polite and a different way to greet you, such as howdy and what’s going on! The hotel only has 4 lifts covering all 30+ floors which can be troublesome if you are on a high floor. The rooms are very clean, TV, no alarm clocks, sink in the bedroom, shower and toilet is just a glass cubicle and no wardrobe (hangers on the wall) and nowhere to store luggage case, no desk, just a small fold away round table big enough for one and a small foldaway chair. I was by myself so it was just about ok, for two? No way. All very off putting when you first stay here, until you get used to the space, it grows on you, but not the wardrobe. Breakfast can be bought next door, in a cool place, however very pricey for what it is, drinks and free morning coffee at the bar on the second floor which is a great area to meet and greet but staff are grumpy. Head to the roof top bar, friendly staff, great vibe, well worth a visit and free entry for hotel guests although it isn’t part of the hotel. So overall, if you want to stay in Chelsea for pleasure and your by yourself for close to the person you’re staying with (literally) then worth it, if you are hear on business or if you like space, stay somewhere else.

Hotel offers cute tiny rooms, ideal for one person. Two people will struggle. The design is spectacular, the architects/decor team thought about every single detail, from the color of the old fashioned telephone matching the sink to the unique hook system in lieu of having a closet. The shelves and safe location (below the bed) was super uncomfortable. The water pressure was great and the quality of the mattress superb, we rested well. There was no fridge in the room but the hotel provided one, which turned out to be the only item in the room that didn't match the decor. Now that's the design part. Let's talk about function. The shower and toilet are housed separately in two tiny, compact adjacent spaces. Only a sliding door with a frosted glass separates them from the room. That means, if you're traveling with a partner or friend, you better ask them (or be asked) to "go take a walk" so the other "can do their thing" because there is no privacy at all. Next, water spills from the shower into the room! We had to use several towels to stop the water pouring into the room. Maintenance installed a tape to prevent the outflow but as you can see in the pic the solution does not work well because the tape hit the adjacent toilet wall (the same sliding door structure opens both spaces) and ripped. The sink is tiny and does not collect water making it difficult to shave. There are no vents in the toilet room so any unpleasant smell propagates into the room. We also experienced problems with the electrical wiring as the same switch on the table lamps turns on the sink area fluorescent light making it uncomfortable for a companion if he/she is sleeping.

The staff was very friendly from check-in to check-out and rooms were very cool and functional. Great location in Chelsea in walking distance to great restaurants and nightlife. Cool bar, very fun vibe overall.

Fun weekend getaway. Surrounded by lots of cool tourist attractions like the chelasa market. Great restaurants, clean rooms,amazing shopping. Close to Madison square garden and Times Square. Friendly staff. Will come back.

Moxy has done a great job creating a unique, consistent customer experience. Front desk staff is upbeat, friendly and willing to go the extra mile. There was a cleaning person whom I asked if I could get an extra water for my room and she brought me - and everyone else waiting at the elevator - a bottle to go. Rooms are small, but with a fun and unique style and very well appointed -- many with awesome views of the city. We stayed for 3 nights and were perfectly comfortable.It's in a great location (the area looks a little suspect at night, but bright and lively during the day) with easy access to everything.We'll definitely stay here again on our next trip to the city!

I loved this place!! We spent just one night there before Christmas and they even gave us Christmas ornaments!!Cool and funky room. Just loved the great use of space. Friendly staff, good location and very clean room! May not be great if traveling with kids or seniors, definitely a younger crowd hotel....though the bigger rooms may work.

In the Heart of the Flower district! Nice to walk on the sidewalks and be surrounded by plants and flowers. Plenty of food options nearby. Room was spacious enough for 1 person. Staff is friendly and nice rooftop bar.

WE had so much fun at this property! Our room was so cool and what a view! The location is great and the on property restaurants are wonderful! Will recommend this place for sure! It was nice to be in a more neighborhood type setting with access to many restaurants and attractions.

I recently stayed four nights here and while the location was stellar, I won't be back. I called the front desk at 1230 am my first night looking for a feather pillow and the staff informed me they only had foam. On day 2 I went and spent 50 bucks on a pillow that was feather only to find out at check out they did, allegedly, have feather pillows. The standard pillows are 5" foam and possibly the worst most uncomfortable hotel pillows I've experienced in 20 years of business travel. Awful.The room at conditioning couldn't be set below 68 and I like to sleep below 65 so that stunk. It was down into the 50s at night, arguably cool enough to open a window at night, problem is you're letting the sounds of NYC in with you. The floor to ceiling windows were amazing but I didn't get one good night's sleep between the pillows and the hard bed. I stayed alone but the shower toilet setup is odd with sliding doors and the sink out in the main sleeping area - I didn't hate it but even in my international travel haven't ever seen a room setup like this. No room for a desk or even a table so ordering in dinner was eaten in bed.The hotel sits on 28th Street and several floral wholesalers are established there so walking to the subway was really beautiful. And the 1 train is only a block away. As a titanium Marriott guest, I was given a slip of 'perks' with my room key like free in room water, but there wasn't even a bottle of water to pay for in my room. Mobile key check in didn't work though I requested it through the app 10 hours before check in. Overall just a lot of hassle and effort to get what I felt were the basics, when I could even get that. The pillows and AC alone was a deal breaker for any future stay.

The hotel was nice, the room was very small for two people. Its a place to sleep and shower but it’s hard to move around in the room. It’s a unique concept where everything you need in hanged on the wall. There was no safe deposit in the room. The is a an amazing rooftop bar with a view on the top floor. The cafe of the hotel is nice with a fresh baked products. The hotel is located in Chelsea and it seems that each hotel brand is represented in the area. It is in the heart of the flower district of NY and there are plenty of eating options in the area within walking distance though nothing that I could write home about . It feels relatively safe to walk at night .

Weekend trip to NY with my daughter. Moxy Chelsea was perfect! Loved the hotel and the awesome staff. Special recognition to Rashan (Engineer!) who helped us move to a really quiet room. And to Danielle at the Front Desk who was great in every sense. Loved it! Would definitely stay again!

Clean and comfortable. Danielle at the front desk was friendly, helpful, and very patient with my questions. Romm was small but very efficiently designed. Air flow was good without being loud or disruptive to sleep.

Really nice hotel with a great style and super location. Free Prosecco on arrival but a shame the rooftop bar isn’t open on Sunday’s. One room was a twin with two queen beds and the toilet had a misted glass toilet door. Fine in the double room but bit personal for friends. Doors are squeaky/noisy - could be easily fixed.Cafe downstairs really good for breakfast, and well priced. Happy to return in the future.

Really enjoyed my stay here at Moxy Chelsea. I actually love Chelsea as there is so much to do in the area, and I find it quite convenient to get to other areas in the city.The rooms are small, but the space is used well. I think that's what adds to the New York chic feel. Also loved walking thru the flower shop to get to the front desk. So pretty and chic.Their 2nd floor is a great spot for food and drinks, as well as to lounge or get some work done on your laptop. Has a very cozy feel to it.Love their cafe downstairs. I had clean eating food options and it was quite yummy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I wasn't expecting this for a hotel in NY. This applies to all from the front desk to the servers to the cleaning staff.Enjoyable stay!

Really loved the design of the hotel and rooms. Staff super friendly and amazing bar and restaurant.The rooms were spacious, with comfortable beds and the rain shower was great.Great city views from my room and convenient location in the heart of Chelsea.Overall staying at The Moxy in Chelsea was an amazing experience!

This place looks chic from the outside and has great restaurants and bars but it's all for show. The rooms are so small there aren't even dressers or closets to unpack. There is no room to lay out a suitcase other than a bed. The elevators are so slow and there is only 1 elevator that takes you to the basement where you have to drop/fetch your luggage. Worst off, the room was dirty. I found prescription pills on the floor of my bathroom and long hair and fuzz all over the floor. When I asked the front desk (there is no concierge) with help getting a car (my phone had died so Uber wasn't an option) two staff told me "oh we don't do that here". Not at all what I expect from a hotel where I paid $500 a night (after tax). Honestly, the Fairfield Inn and Suites is better. More spacious, clean and a great roof top bar in the summer.

Im always at this place. The staff is lovely, the energy is high. The restaurant downstairs is killer Italian ... straight out of Rome. Service is great, Claudia in front desk is great. The bar is something interesting (second floor)

Hip new Marriott property. Room is non-traditionally appointed, but everything seems well thought out and works well. Only issue was that the HVAC was quite strong and the room felt like a wind tunnel.

Checked into my room and found it smelled like cigarettes. Likely the last guest was smoking out the window - housecleaning should have flagged this and re-mediated the problem instead of putting me in this room. Front desk was not very helpful in resolving this. Hotel has a cool bar though.

I recently enjoyed a 1-night stay in the stylish and fun Moxy hotel in Chelsea. I loved the delightful city views from my 29th floor room, which felt both hip and spacious. The bed was super comfy and the waterfall shower was perfectly roomy and refreshing. I had ample sink and count space for all of my bathroom ammenities, makeup, and hair items. Check in was quick and painless, and staff was very friendly. Excellent location in the city - it was a super easy jumping point for my wedding dress appointments in Chelsea the following day.For areas of improvement, the lack of separate closet space might be less ideal for longer stays, but the hangers along the wall worked out well for my one night. It also wasn't clear to me if there was room service available from the linked restaurants or not, which would have been nice with my later arrival from the airport, and without any fridge/mini-bar (although, I can't complain about the lack of fridge noise overnight).Overall, a great deal for my Marriott points, and would be more than happy to return!

To be honest, I never considered staying at this hotel because the name was off putting to me. Luckily, fate and a last-minute deal brought us together. File this hotel under “essential” when you want to travel NY stylishly without paying a fortune. Let’s start with arrival. To get to check in you walk through a flower shop. Cool and unexpected. Then you’re greeted by someone really nice and helpful. In my case, it was Claudia who hooked me up with a great room (3001 for those who care) with a view. Not only that, I’d arrived early with a 40 pound pack on my back and she got me into the room. Relief and gratitude ensued. Throughout my stay I’d see her and she’d check in on my stay. Friendly. Professional. And went beyond the call of duty. Great first impression. Oh, and they give you a complimentary glass of Prosecco. Now let’s talk about the space. Yes, the rooms are NY-standard small. But the clever design maximizes the space and make it a pleasure. I’m stealing the hang-on-a-peg solution. It works. The real lobby is a beautifully designed 2nd floor divvied up into atrium with plenty of work spaces (with hidden outlets), a bar, and a pizzeria. I took full advantage of the first two spots and never felt like I was trapped in a hotel. The gym is surprisingly well stocked. I’d like to see the cable fly machine repaired and a couple of Pelotons added, but otherwise it’s great for its size. Dumbbells: check. The attached restaurant Feroce is a legit trattoria. Ate three meals here which is ridiculous in a town full of restaurants. There’s also a rooftop bar which I didn’t check out but sounds like a great amenity. Overall, this had everything I needed as a business traveler (including a great common work space) and a few things I didn’t know I’d love so much (like a Negroni menu). Nice work, team.

This hotel is located near all of the florists so you have a beautiful, botanical walk when visiting. The food at the restaurant was delish, and the complimentary first round of bubbly is a great touch.

We loved the Moxy’s 28th Street location set amid a block of wholesale flower shops - the whole street smelled amazing! (Not typical for NYC ;)We walked nearly everywhere from here...to Greenwich Village, Flatiron, Union Square, Washington Square, Peloton studio, and more.Rooms are small but laid out very well...the floor to ceiling windows make it feel bigger.
