Big walk-in shower. Closets are a waste of precious space in a hotel room this size, so we didn’t care there wasn’t a closet...we liked the wall hooks. Lots of hooks, lots of elec outlets. Moxy has a nice open air Italian style cafe on the main level, and its Italian restaurant on the 2nd floor had really good flatbread pizza. The rooftop bar Fleur Room is awesome! Amazing views of the city and the sunset. Fancy cocktails. After dark it’s a trendy nightclub. If you’re staying at the hotel then you’re “automatically” on the guest list to get in. =)

Hip, clean, new, convenient place to stay in NYC. Just blocks from Penn Station, a (longer) but easy walk to Broadway, and centrally located in general, this hotel boasts the best of a luxury hotel (good service, hip common space, swanky bar and lounge, that makes-you-feel-fabulous appeal) but forgoes luxury hotel rooms themselves for a more minimalistic, industrial, functional but tiny hotel room, date I say almost dorm like rooms. But, like, if a dorm were fabulous. In my opinion, fitting a comfortable king sized bed and remaining clean, new, appealing and fun is well worth the more sterile, industrial, small room, especially for the lower cost. After all, why spend time in your room when in NY!

Fact: hotel rooms in NYC are small.Fact: the Moxy Chelsea is no exception.Good location and cool design BUT the sink is IN the room (try putting in contact lenses, brushing teeth and applying make up at 6:30 am while your partner tries to sleep.... Might be a better idea to go single or find another hotel if you bring a partner.NO closet - wooden hooks on wall and 3 small shelves under bed for any storage. Tiny fold up chair and table if you need to work - don't bother - go to 2nd floor lounge.Shower was good however. The bar is a big 'scene' after work on week days.

A fabulous find in 28th street, just a few minutes walk from the subway. Located the flower & fashion district, the hotel is in a fun neighbourhood that is central to great shops, restaurants and bars. The rooms are a little small, but are well appointed and clean. The staff are very friendly & helpful and made my stay an absolute pleasure. Regardless of whether you're staying at the hotel, you must visit the rooftop bars. They have a wide selection of beverages and a solid grazing menu. Again, the staff are very friendly and attentive with a strong service ethic. We didn't wait long for drinks or food. The bars have a great vibe and the views take in the Empire State Building and south Manhattan, with glimpses of the Hudson.

Great service and amazing view. The vibe is amazing, the music is cool. Bartenders are real proffesionals. We had a great time, probably come again on our next travel to NYC. I'll recommend my friends for sure

This is a very nice new hotel. The rooms are small; NY size for this type of accommodations but the overall place is very well designed, very comfortable, and employees are very helpful and have lots of good energy. When you walk in through the main entrance, you realize that the lobby is very small, however the 2nd floor has the restaurant and the bar. Everything is very well appointed. The rooms are very nice, very nice and very modern. Overall I recommend this hotel!!!

Stayed at the Moxy for a week whilst visiting New York for my brother in laws wedding. The styling of the place was impeccable with an amazing terrace and rooftop view. Would definitely recommend and we’d stay here again!!

We stayed here for two nights. It’s a great addition to the brand. I love the simplicity of the hotel and it’s breutyfully decorated. It fits in well with the neighborhood. The staff is so friendly. Just a helpful tip, when you get in the elevator scan your card then press the floor you want to go to. I guess it’s a security measure. Our room had a nice view of the city. We were on the 9th floor in a corner room with two double beds. It was pretty spacious. The windows are big and you can let a little air in. The blackout curtains are wonderful. We slept well and it was quiet. The bathroom is beautiful and has just enough space. Everything was neat and clean. The 2nd floor bar is beautiful! Make sure you walk around and enjoy the conservatory as well. The bocce and pizza area was so nice. You need your room key and ID to go up to the 35th floor for Fleur. It is breathtaking. Wonderfully decorated. The views up there are like no other. I would definitely return as soon as possible

Conveniently located in the flower district and close to the Highline, this hip Moxy exceeded our expectations. Getting to the (amazing views) rooftop bar is a bit complicated (elevator is actually next to the guest room elevators but you have to get out on the street and re-enter the hotel and get a stamp on your hand) but the views are worth it. Music however in the rooftop bar was so loud that conversation is not possible. So we took pictures and moved back to the 2nd story bar. Very attentive and friendly service. Cafe integrated downstairs, but unfortunately mostly carb heavy (bread) choices.

The Moxy Chelsea has quickly become my first choice when staying in NYC. First off, the property is about a 7-8 minute walk from Penn Station so tourists are have easy access to both Amtrak and major subway lines. Upon checking in at the Moxy Chelsea, you get a token for a free glass of Prosecco at the bar (lovely touch). This was my third stay at the property and the front desk staff are always pleasant and professional. The size of my room was comparable to other hotels in similar price ranges, but so smartly laid out that it seemed larger. What really sets this hotel apart from others in its' class are the details--the Roman-inspired bars and restaurants, the token for Prosecco at check-in and the entrance through a flower shop. Would highly recommend!

Arrived and was greeted by nice staff. Rooms are brand new and the beds are comfortable. Responsive staff should you need anything. Roof top had amazing views of the Empire building, and a nice wine selection.

What a great hotel. From the moment you walk in you are made to feel completely welcome and at home. Great staff throughout the hotel. Rooms were perfect - surprisingly large in my opinion. Pristine clean and super comfy beds.The bar and restaurant were both excellent. The welcome drink of Prosecco another lovely touch in an already fabulous hotel. Definitely will be back when next in NY!

NewYork Fashion week and vacation trip,it was a great experience will visit again in 2020.I look forward to another great experience.The only thing about the hotel I didn't like was the rooms were to small.

Walked into the lobby to beautiful flowers that smelled amazing. I was quicked greeted by Danielle. She was uber nice and made me feel at home instantly. Later that evening I needed ice and Danielle and Linda both jumped in and made it happen. Thank you, Moxy for employing theses two amazing women!

I've stayed in several different Marriott properties in NYC for work and the Moxy NYC Chelsea by far has been my favorite. The location is extremely central with several different subway lines a short distance away. It's far enough from 42nd St and the core of midtown to not be terribly crowded with tourists. Additionally, there are an abundance of nice coffee shops, juice shops, bakeries, etc., to make it extremely convenient for grab and go options. The room is small, but very clever with storage solutions and very well designed. We had a great view on the 22nd floor. We also had drinks several times at the hotel bar with good service. One negative, I asked for a hair dryer several times and never received one. You would think it would be somewhat standard issue for a hotel room. Every time you walk out you are surrounded by cut flowers and plants since the hotel is situated in NYC's flower district. It's really nice to stop and smell the roses before you head out to work or play. As a Marriott gold member, they upgraded me to a higher floor, it might be worthwhile to ask if you are similarly situated. My first time staying at a Moxy and I would do so again after this experience.

Stayed at the Moxy Chelsea on a recent business trip to NYC. Perfect location for me to easily get uptown and downtown and to get to and from JFK airport via train. The space is young and hip and very Manhattan. Room was compact but had everything I needed and was fashioned excellently. Only major complaint about the room was the hair dryer - low power and low heat, not particularly useful. The bar is very cool (love the decor) and the pizzeria had an interesting array of pizzas. The prices are bit high (even by Manhattan standards) but the quality was on point. Will definitely keep this location on my list of hotels for my NYC trips. (Has a roof top bar, but didn’t make it up there on this trip. Seems like a spot very much geared toward millennial travelers - for business or pleasure, which suits me.)

We really enjoyed our stay at Moxy Chelsea. As previous NYC locals, I can say that this hotel has the best location. It avoids all the tourist crowds in Times Square and it is steps away from the subway and walking distance to all my favorite neighborhoods. The rooms are stylish and the bed was super comfortable. Definitely check our the rooftop bar for some nice views and a nice cocktail or two.

My husband and I stayed here for two nights over the weekend. Before Arriving I called the front desk as I had not received my mobile key from the Bonvoy app. I was assured that the key was on its way. By the time we arrived at the hotel (an hour later) I still had not received it so we waited in the line to check in. Our room was on the 14th floor, with a view of the adjacent buildings. The room efficiently designed, but very tiny. There was barely any room to lay out my carry on suite case. On the first night my husband fell ill and wanted some hot water to take some meds. There is no coffee maker in the room so I called the front desk. Rather than offering to deliver the hot water the front desk suggested that I go to the second floor bar. I had to get out of bed and change so I can make my way to the bar. Based on this, I just assumed that the hotel doesn't offer any service to your room. However, on our departure day I called the front desk to inquire about the ice machine. I was told that ice is only available by delivery to your room. Very strange since we couldn't get hot water delivered when we needed it. I found the service inconsistent. For it's price I believe you are better off at James Nomad or Maritime.

I went with my girl and our baby and it certainly was not the right choice for a family hotel. It is price well and I get it but the standard rooms certainly are not meant for a family and / or baby with you. It was so cramped and small. I couldn't go to the rooftop with my baby. There wasn't even a closet or dresser...only hooks on the wall flanking the TV for hanging garments and a drawer built into the bed. Ay ay ayyyy....I think this hotel is more meant for single traveling millennials ;-)ALTHOUGH, the food in the hotel and Italian Restaurant below especially was magnificent!!!

This hotel is a very cool structure in a sparkling spot of the city. I have been there for business purposes in May. Check in was super quick and the person who take care of me was extremely professional and helpful. The room was a disappointment. Although young and cool, it was mega small I was alone and had a king size. I wonder if I was sharing the room ( a double) how uncomfortable would have been to share the very little space available, It was an high floor, and the view was stunning.There is no breakfast but next door there is the wonderful Feroce, which beyond serving amazing italian food for lunch and dinner has an incredible selection of typical Italian breakfast Items. Another good thing about the Moxy are the bar at the second floor, where the wood oven pizza from the legendary Roscioli family from Rome is served, and the Fleur Room, a cool night club with a fantastic 360 view of the city. So, despite the lack of room space, a cool place to be.

I've stayed at the Moxy in Chelsea about three times now and love it more and more every time. You enter the property through a tiny flower shop which I think is genius since the street where is located is known for having many plant stores. The check-in process was seamless and the front office team is down to earth and delightful. I want to give a special shoutout to Chris Piompo who went above and beyond to help me with dinner reservations. The housekeeping team was also incredibly friendly, always greeting me with a smile when I'd see them in the halls. Overall, I highly recommend this property! The rooms are a bit on the smaller side but they have everything you need to enjoy yourself.

Love this hotel - 2nd time I have stayed here since it opened and only gets better. Rooms are standard sive for New York, but with all the hopping public spaces you don't wnat to be in room for long anyway. Hp rooftop spot. Great 2nd floor space for hanging out in mornings, later becoming great bar. Best Italian restaurant in New York. Service throughout hotel impeccable!

Always great and positive energy when checking in and staying at the Moxy @ Chelsea. I prefer the small and cozy rooms. Always a great view of the city from higher rooms. Bed and pillows are perfectly comfortable. Shower is great to. If anything, I would like a bigger sink, but as I said, small cozy and hip is great!

We had a great stay at the moxy labor day weekend. In town for a wedding a few blocks away, it was the perfect chic landing pad. Thanks to our welcome drink tokens we met up with friends in the 2nd floor bar. Beautiful space and great service from both bar and hotel staff.Next time I'd like to make it up to the 35th floor to check out the view from there!

Just to set expectations, this is not your typical hotel. The rooms are very small, but have efficient design (example - no closets). But somehow you have everything you need. The vibe is very cool. Front desk staff - awesome. 5 stars.Location - great. Check out Hudson Yards place. Walking distance to the hotel.Breakfast at the Feroce Caffè was delicious. Sometimes hard to get a table. Try Feroce Ristorante - our dinner was excellent.We loved pizza from Bar Feroce. After a day of exploring the city, we wanted a low key dinner. Got 2 pizzas - fantastic! There is plenty of cozy tables to crash at. The bar itself was lacking the cool friendly vibe you feel everywhere else at the hotel. I stayed at a Moxy hotel in Germany, and the bar staff there was so awesome - it made for a very welcoming atmosphere, and there were always people hanging out.Surprisingly, with such a vibrant scene, the rooms were quiet, and we got a great night sleep.Well done. We'll be back.

The Moxy Chelsea is the perfect spot. The rooms are small but well-designed (especially the bathrooms), clean and perfect for your needs. Great vibe in both the second floor lounge and rooftop bar. Good location near Koreatown, Penn Station, Hudson awards and Chelsea. Only downside is that the staff, while friendly, are not all that knowledgeable about the surrounding area.

We came to NYC to celebrate our anniversary! Since we got here we were received with such warm and friendliness by the staff! The smell on the entrance is amazing as well as the environment in the hotel! The room was beautiful, a little bit smaller than we are use to, but I understand that that is part of the concept. Unfortunately I could not catch the names of the front desk clerks but I must say that they were amazing! If I have to come back to NYC I will try to stay here. Location and service are top notch!

Danielle was very nice and helped my wife and I multiple times. Even though it was 1am, she was awake and down to help. In terms of the hotel, it was clean, quiet and had a nice bed, in a nice location. The only odd thing was “LUST” written in tile in the bathroom. Sort of tacky and creepy for people w kids. Why the sexual tile message? Either way, great hotel . Will go again .

Great location in Chelsea, great views from the rooms and cool vibe in the lounge/bar area and upstairs in the Fleur Room on 35th floor. Very chic! The rooms are tight and not much storage space so better for one person or for a short 1 or 2 night stay. Don’t plan to check in early on the weekends. High demand!

Moxy Chelsea is the perfect place to stay when visiting NYC. The location is fabulous, the rooms are so well done, the rooftop is amazing, and the service is 2nd to none. I travel to NY often, and plan to make Moxy Chelsea my go-to spot.

What a breath of fresh air -- literally !!! I have stayed in literally hun dress and hundreds of hotels from Hampton Inns t0 6 Star European masters, and nome is like this one. The entrance is easily confused with that of a florist with its Putnam & Putnam display -- a perfect match for 28th Street in Chelsea -- the NYC's "Jungle" in the City !!! Service and amenities match the entrance experience.

Nice hotel - good location in Chelsea, friendly service, reasonable prices, modern and clean. The only downside here is that the rooms are VERY small - even for NYC. There is no bathroom - just shower and toilet stalls (yes stalls) right in the bedroom. So make sure you know who you're staying with really well because you'll be seeing - and hearing - EVERYTHING.No desk, no chair, no closet either. Basically a door, a bed, a sink and 2 stalls. Some hooks on the wall for clothing and folding furniture - just make sure to fold it before you try to walk around the bed.Nice pizza cafe behind the bar on the 2nd floor.

They called her the new kid on the block & well yes. She’s fresh hip new and comfy. My 17 year old and 15 year definitely were impressed that I didn’t book an average twin bed hotel room. The moxy is where you want to be. The rooms are NY apartment size. Loved the decor and furniture. The Tv was a great size. Awesome feeling to watch a movie and turn to look out side and see the paradise of lights from the other buildings. Views for days. The hotel has a restaurant. Front desk staff was so nice and welcoming! the staff throughout the hotel was so helpful. If you book in NY expect fees to park the car. Expect to wait for elevators. Do not be unrealistic. In the night hours the hotel bar is a scene for the locals so it feels busy but it does not effect the hotel. The hotel is very well managed. From the restaurant to way up to the top. The only area of the hotel that I felt needed some attention from management was the cafe. The wait staff is stressed. They ran out of cups to sell iced coffee. When breakfast food came out the waitress did not know who the food went to. The plates were dancing around from table to table. On a different occasion I opted for a hot macchiato it was not executed correctly. I was upset because Starbucks is just a block or two down the street. Then in the afternoon there’s a person that stands in the bathroom that is in between the restaurant and cafe. The person is there with a tray of money & You feel obligated to tip! It’s uncomfortable. Other than that the experience at the Moxy was worth it and I recommend it for your New York experience.

I would do this on my regular TripAdvisor account but I, unfortunately, cannot seem to login. Either way I wanted to make sure I made a new account to review this hotel, as I genuinely feel they deserved it.I am a NYC native and staycation at different hotels once a month for fun. Normally I pick new hotels each time, for the experience, but I loved this Moxy so much that I will 100% be back. The vibe throughout the entire hotel is fun, hip, playful, friendly and unique. The staff is incredibly personable, thoughtful, knowledgeable and seemingly very genuine. There is a gorgeous little restaurant for breakfast directly adjacent a beautiful, and well kept, flower filled entrance. I was overall really impressed and want to thank all the staff at the property for being such incredible hosts.

Amazing bed and shower - great service. Perfect for a weekend stay in NYC. Quick access to and from the airport (via Penn Station) right between the 7th (ACE) and 6th ave (BDFM) subways. The rooms are a bit small but they all are in NYC!

Everything about this hotel is great! The staff are wonderful and the location is great! The only place I will stay in NY! The front desk staff helped me with everything that was needed during my stay.

Small room space but has all the things you need. Always packed elevator rides which can be uncomfortable, but overall not bad given the price and location. The rooftop bar is amazing, night view is great.

For such a highly starred hotel, I was shocked by the room. Barely enough space for the bed. Sink in the bedroom. Bathroom and toilet just a partition separated from the bed, no space for even a table, and NO closets or drawers! I had to keep my soiled clothes on the bed the whole time I was there. Never going there again.

I was in the city to visit my fiance who is working in NYC for 2 months. We hadn't seen each other in a month, and really just wanted to stay in, snuggle, and watch movies. Check-in with Lisa was super easy, she upgraded us to a higher floor, and was super nice and gracious. I was a little worried it would be noisy, but we heard NOTHING! The room was clean, and welcoming. Neither one of us had slept that well in a while. Being able to sign-in to our netflix acount was an added bonus for home away from home vibes. Marvin was super nice at check-out and we chatted for a bit. The entire staff was friendly, super knowledgeable about the area, and forever smiling. This is definitely our new go-to hotel in the city. We'll be back!

This was our first time staying at the Moxy Chelsea and we absolutely loved it! The highlight of our stay was the gorgeous view of the Empire State Building ( from our room and from the rooftop bar). Christian and Marvin were so helpful and always a friendly face to see. Thank youfor everything!

The staff at the hotel was super nice to upgrade us to a bunk bed room for my daughter's 18th birthday. It made a world of difference as the # of people in our party grew, making it possible for a fun two days in NYC. All the staff was very pleasant and helpful--always greeting us when we came in. Really good croissants at the cafe on the ground floor.

Easy to get to from midtown tunnel, flower district. Enjoyed my stay, everything you need is on property or close by. Stayed at other Moxy’s and this one is the best. Nice staff, nice atmosphere.Rooms are small but it’s New York, every hotel is like that. Rooms are efficiently designed.

Great place, friendly staff, new, clean, very good restaurant ground floor. comfortable bar and lounge on 2nd floor. rooms are ok size with great windows and shades that work to block out light. air works well and quietly.

Beautiful views. good location. Bar at top was beautiful but too much attitude. Hotel gas a bit of a cold feel to it. Overall gorgeous though. Location is fantastic. Accessible to eveything. Bed was really nice.

review_body: This is a cool boutique hotel. I was here a few days for work in May 2019. Be warned that it is a little tricky to find at first as the front looks like a flower shop and the lounge part of the lobby is actually on the 2nd floor. The room was clean/comfortable. It was near a subway station. Plus, they gave me a token for some free Bubbles at check-in! I would definitely stay there again.

If you would like a birds eye view of the H&M building spire or want to try to get into the hip rooftop bar and club, with its elusive dress code, then the Moxy Chelsea may be for you. But if you can’t get into the club, just request an upper floor and you will get to listen to the dj’s heavy bass beats until the wee hours of the next morning even if you put in heavy duty earplugs. Not a great experience, especially when you request a quiet room.Otherwise, the Moxy has an urban industrial vibe, and the rooms are exactly as pictured - clean and well designed, but with little space for your bags or other accoutrement. The bottom line is there are many other NYC hotels with larger and nicer rooms, better service, and far better locations for similar or better prices.

First impressions are lasting impressions.....The Moxy Chelsea gives you that great first impression feeling as soon as you enter the floral lobby...you know you are going to like this hotel....the front desk staff are welcoming and professional...They make you feel that you are about to have a wonderful stay.....room accommodations are unique and yes the future concepts of hotels is already at the Moxy Chelsea.....Upbeat decor throughout the hotel makes you fell alive as well.....whether you are here for a business conference, vacation or that quick little get-a- way, you can't go wrong ...great location for getting around NYC....definitely a "must do" if you are planning to come to NYC

If you are looking for a boutique hotel while ensuring you earn Marriott point, the Moxy is the hotel for you. It is only six months old, super clean and quaint. I was lucky enough to enjoy a room on the 29th floor of the Empire State Building. The staff were super friendly and providing me with a free drink token at check-in for the second floor bar. I plan to stay at this hotel again the next time I return to NYC. It is also very conveniently located in the Fashion District/Chelsea.

Moxy got most of it correct, My room had a door way a reasonable sized batch room the remainder top the room which about an 18 inch path in front the sides in the middle of the room, the wall had a folding bake and two folding chairs which I guess would act as a small round coffee table. No others to sit or stand,Well done well throughout, until they get to that one other item, the bed. To the design team, you completely failed. To address there are eight inch drawers under the platform that was a bed like thing on it, so if you are willing to get down on the floor and stuff things where no room light can reach and then sleep on a bed which at the vest is 16 inches from the ground, the coolest part any movement causes the bed to slide off the smooth Platform. Fortunately, when one slides with the bed off the side at night which I did twice you don’t fall far and you can reasebke it quickly.Service was efficient but not friendly, I asked about a Thai restaurant but they recommend one, of course ten within the block.So if the test did they deliver an efficient small room the answer is yes, they just forgot a bed one could sleep in,

I have to say (and even did say this to the front desk staff - who are amazing!) that even though the rooms are on the smaller side.....the dedication to service and the passion for hospitality really made me feel on top of the world.....the floor-to-ceiling windows did help with that as well!I have stayed at many, MANY Marriott properties over the past year as I wanted to take full advantage of my top-tier status (Platinum Ambassador) and I honestly can say that the Moxy Chelsea is at the top of my list for making me actually feel special and unique. Shots go out to the front desk staff who checked me in that night (guy and a girl, both very professional but fun and welcoming.....omg they will kill me because i forgot their names but help me out here!) review_body: Great location with many amenities. All the rooms were clean and very quaint. The hotel entryway was so inviting and the staff was extremely friendly. If you are looking for a different type of hotel stay, this is worth a try.

What a great time at an adorable boutique hotel. Great location! Beautiful views. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Delicious cafe. Walking distance to Chelsea market. Would definitely go back. Won’t be disappointed.

review_body: Everyone here was great! Especially Danny at check in. Lots to don hotel but also many things in neighborhood. Restaurant in hotel had good options- staff attentive! Hotel centrally located for our needs! Will he back!

This was a combo business and pleasure trip. EVERYTHING at Moxy Chelsea is spot on. Brand new hotel, friendly and attentive staff, cool atmosphere. Hope it stays as pristine as it is now. Only (minor) criticism would be to have the staff throttle back on their overblown and contrived “hipster cool speak”. You’ll know what I mean when you call them from outside or inside. But nothing more than a slight distraction. I will definitely be returning soon.

Great location, love the flower shop entrance, and the service...everyone from the front desk to the bar was fantastic. It was my 8-year-old's first time to NYC and the receptionist got us a room with a view of the Empire State Building. It made our trip!! The bartender also made her a mocktail after learning what she liked. It's also near subway lines and restaurants. Keep in mind that the toilet and shower doors open directly into the bedroom (it's like a studio), but it was no problem for my daughter and me. And while it's got a clubby atmosphere, there were also a few other families with young children there.

This is sort a hipster hotel in the vicinity of Penn Station. I stayed 1 night with wife; room was small though comfortable but definitely not a place I would recommend for more than a night or 2 since there is basically no dressers or closets to put your clothing so you end up living out of the suitcase (there is a draw or 2 underneath the bed and hooks on the wall to hang things, but it is not as convenient as conventional room. The rooftop bar is a fun place to have a drink. On second floor, brick oven, thin crust pizza is very good.

review_body: Our stay at Moxy was wonderful! I love to find good quality boutique hotels that are unique and The Moxie is definitely that. We loved the garden district. It was like a botanical neighborhood within NYC. The connecting restaurant, Feroce, is excellent!! The location is perfect to go anywhere in the city. Walk one block, the subway uptown or downtown takes you anywhere in the city. So, conveniently located to many attractions. Finally, all of the staff were very polite and service friendly. This was our 35th Anniversary and the entire staff made this a special occasion for us. Thanks for the attention to details. We will return.

Used my 1 night free Marriott bonvoy stay with my 3 teens, it was quite a tight space for 4 of us ,lucky enough it was only for a night . I couldn’t say any fault at all . Love the room . Also the kids are underage so we’re not allowed to go up the rooftop to look at the view ( from what I heard it’s beautiful there at night )

The beauty of the Moxy isnt a huge room. The rooms are small but perfectly done to make use of the space. In return you get great location, Really great team members on hand, cool bars and lounge areas. Pro tip: great rain shower!

review_body: Good Boutique Hotel in the heart of the Flower District. It was a girls trip and we had a blast. The location is easily accessible to all the major tourist sites. Service was excellent. The rooms are a little small but great views. There are 4 bars and the atmosphere is cool with a young crowd occupying most of the time. Very modern upbeat hotel with the beautiful people.......

Great location in Chelsea. Short walk from Penn Station. All of the staff were very welcoming starting with Claudia at Reception and continuing with elevator personnel and in both bar areas! I will be back!

I have been staying at this hotel 3-4 times a month since it opened. Staff has always been great and the rooms have been super clean. If looking for a gym, the Moxy Chelsea has one of the best in Mid-Town. Not only does is have all the basics, but it also has plenty of open space for doing your own workouts.

After a horrible experience at a nearby sister property we decided to stay this visit at The Moxy. The rooms are not big but the king size bed is so comfortable and we love the shower! The team there is very accommodating and personable. We highly recommend this property and will be staying there again.

review_body: The room is compact and perfectly comfortable. No wasted space, exactly what you need after a long hot day in the city. Staff are very warm and welcoming. Room was spotless and bed was comfortable. Nice view of the Empire State Building.

The Moxy Chelsea is brand new. The shower is awesome especially the water pressure. The workout center has everything, weights, cardio, pull up bars and plenty of room. The hotel room is small by New York standards but perfect for one. Or two if they don’t mind being cozy. The hotel is located in flower district, so it’s a fragrant walk to the subway a block or so away. I will go back there next time in NYC.

This hotel is in a great location which is why we chose it. We travelled as a family of 4- two adults, a 12 year old and a 14 year old. The staff was friendly and helpful. However we will not be staying here again. There is absolutely no bathroom privacy. The bathroom walls are thin frosted glass and you can see and hear everything. This may be ok for some travelers but not for us.

One of the most unique hotels to stay in! From the beautiful floral lobby, the super friendly staff, to the small, but comfortable rooms! Loved the views from our room and the rooftop bar. Needed extra towels and housekeeping was there in minutes!! Looking forward to staying again

This hotel is well located easy access to everywhere. The staffs are professionals . Rooms very trendy for a younger crowd but rather small . This is the Moxy style . Upon check in we had presented three different credit cards . Check in time was around 8pm . A few hour later at 1am all of these cards were hacked and fraudulent used for on line purchases an toll paid . At 5am when I noticed these charges through the messages received on the phone I went down and advised the front desk and told of my concerns but the response was cold and indifferent . I had written to my ambassador about the incident who in turn transmitted the message to the hotel but no further response .So this is a very unpleasant thing to happen as I had to report to my credit cards issuance bank and cancelled all the credit cards to prevent further fraudulent use .

I stayed here with my wife and we really enjoyed it. The location was central so it was very easy for us to get around the city. The staff was always friendly and always put us in a good mood. The hotel itself is chic and has a lounge and nice rooftop bar. Room was clean and comfortable. There's also a small deli nearby that's open 24/7 if you needed to grab any snacks/drinks. Would definitely come back!

At first sight Moxy looks like any other boutique hotel, however that is where the similarities stop. Rooms are quite, comfortable with some great view. The second floor has plugs for 100’s of computers and busy travelers. Staff was friendly, accommodating and respectful. Big Props to Moxy

We had a view of the Empire State Building from our room. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. The rooms are compact and don't expect a wardrobe - but the whole of the one wall is fitted with hooks on which to hang your stuff. Shower is big and luxurious. Don't forget to visit the 'Fleur' roof top bar with more amazing views of the the New York sky-line. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Honestly I can go on and on about the food at ferocce, the rooftop bar, floor to ceiling windows but it’s all about the staff. I stay there once a month and they treat me like gold. From the minute I walk in I get greeted by name which is always nice. They always give me some extra drink chips and if I need anything they are there for me.

I had a reservation at another hotel but stumbled upon Moxy and thought I would give it a try. I LOVE the Chelsea area and I frequent NYC alot for work so I have been everywhere. Chelsea is quieter than some of the other areas of NYC and I love the flower district. This hotel is within walking distance of Penn Station/MSG, Macy's, etc. There are plenty of restaurant and bar options in the area. So, the room:Pros:comfortable bed, great shower/water pressure, it was quiet! No street noise. I didn't hear my neighbors. Staff were super friendly and helpful. This hotel opened Feb 2019 so everything was fresh/new. My room 1708 - had a great view of the ESB.Cons:No refrigerator and no ice machines - you have to request ice. The room is SMALL. If I had someone with me - it would have been very tight. We would have been competing for space and if you have a large suitcase - yeah - that would take up a lot of space in the room. One garbage can in the toilet stall - and that's literally what it is. A stall with a toilet and sliding door . Fine for just me (weird though if you leave the door open you have a full view of yourself in the full length mirror across from you). Shower - same - shower stall - nice products to use (shampoo/shower gel and conditioner). but the door slides - which was fine. Fire alarm at 1:45 - I was so disoriented I didn't know what was going on at first. I inquired the next morning about it and they said that sometimes the "steam" from the shower sets them off - that's not good. Oh and the bar in the hotel apparently gets a lot of business from outside customers. It had a night club feel - i wasn't comfortable going in there alone so I forfeited my wooden coin for free champagne that . you get upon check-in. Roof top bar was closed for a private event which was fine with me because I wouldn't have gone anyway. oh and lastly the room was clean overall, but there were multiple "hairs" that were not mine on the floor, shower, bed, and toilet. It was a little icky. I would stay here again, but it wouldn't be my choice if my husband was with me. It was too tight.

Awesome New Hotel, Clean Modern Rooms, Great Location in the Chelsea District, Easy Walking Distance to all Sights, Sounds and Attractions of NYC, Friendly Outgoing Staff and Great Value for Mid-Manhattan!

Stayed here with my family for four nights in July.The location is a couple of blocks from Penn Station in Manhattan. Lobby is small, with florist shop and cafe in same area.Rooms are compact, however they have been designed quite cleverly with a lot of hooks to hand things up.We had two rooms, one with great views of Empire State Building and the bunk bed room which slept four, ideal for our teenagers. Both were spotless.We enjoyed the comp drinks we were awarded upon check in, and the comp coffee in the morning was also a nice touch.Will return here for sure next time I am in NY.

Been staying in NY regularly for 20+ years and have had a number of favorites through that time period. As of early 2019 Moxy in Chelsea is my new favorite. Great, central location half block from the 1-line subway. Small but beautiful front lobby bordering a boutique flower shop that you walk through to gain entry. Great 2nd floor bar and 1st floor cafe for breakfast. The free Sparkling wine chips to use at the 2nd floor bar and given upon check-in is a nice bonus. The rooftop bar which is managed by a seperate company, while not open air, has one of the best 360 views in the city. Bedrooms are flawless though extremely small so be prepared. If your not familiar with the Moxy concept, no closet exist so you hang your clothes on the wall. Small cubbies exist under the bed for folded clothes. Amazingly well designed and comfortable bed directly across a huge flat panel TV in every room. I'm a fan of the clean and warm colored fake wood floors and well designed furnishings, not the bare bones Ikea look used at similar minimalist hotels. The Moxy splurges with its bathroom finish outs which include products that are almost as good as what you would expect at W Hotels. Front desk staff is pleasant and helpful with zero attitude. Elevators can be a bit on the slow side at times, but not a deal killer. Looking forward too many more stays.

I’ve never stayed in a smaller hotel room, I’m here with the wife and baby, yet there is no room for the crib, especially once the luggage and stroller fit in. Had to ask for a fridge, which is laughable, even more so when there is no thought as to where it should go in the room, other than between the two beds and in front of the telephone and small desk. Feel like I’m in the YMCA or at worst, I’ve been punished and held captive. $400 a night...shaking my head!!!

Our little Big City getaway was amazing because of Moxy Chelsea. The views of the city were gorgeous both day and night, the curtains were never closed. We soaked up every moment of the breathtaking scenery surrounding us. The room was a perfect size, from the king sized bed to the rain fall shower. The staff at your location were fast, friendly, and extremely accommodating. Thank you for making our stay unforgettable.

The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. The staff is Amazing . Bed super comfortable. Overall very cute hotel and ambiance. Beautiful bar with good coffee. Great location to explore Chelsea. I would highly recommend

I truly enjoyed my last stay at Moxy NYC Chelsea. Staff is well trained and it shows. Cleanliness is outstanding. I would defintely return and recommend this hotel. Danny the front desk staff was amazing and truly never made us feel as just another customer. This young man deserves a 5+One advice I would offer is to try to find a way to settle account at departure, I feel I had to check my account too many times to understand the money charged, the pre $20 / day, then rest but still waiting for adjustments 2 days later

I spent 5 nights at the Moxy Chelsea in late June with my partner (at the end of a long trip across the USA, our 15th hotel in 4 weeks). Loved it, perfect end to a great trip.Location of the hotel is excellent, easy to get everywhere. Only 5 min walk from Penn Station which was handy for us arriving by Amtrak, then leaving to airports. Easy to get everywhere.Room - stayed in a king bed city view room. It was a great room and tastefully decorated. I had an accessible room so I think it may have been slightly bigger than normal. Views were amazing. Bed super comfy. Excellently kitted out. We had a few minor issues with housekeeping forgetting to service the room but the helpful staff managed this efficiently so there really wasn't an issue.The hotel itself is great - staff very friendly and helpful. Free coffee on 2nd floor each day in the very nicely set up Bar Feroce. You can buy espresso coffee and pastries etc from the ground floor cafe which is not bad (the cafe itself isn't amazing though for breakfast). Pret and Starbucks only a few minutes away too. The fitness room is v well decked out.I'd stay here again for sure.

I absolutely loved my stay at the Moxy! It was small, but extremely comfortable. It gave me everything I needed, without the extra fluff that hot rooms charge you hundreds more for. The view was spectacular, the bed was so so comfey, and I loved how quirky yet adorable the room was. The service at the front desk was always nice, they were always smiling, and so helpful when we asked questions. The location is close to Chelsea Market. Hudson Yards, Madison Square park, and some cool places, all within walking distance. I would 100% book here again when I come to the city. I love this place!

We had a blast staying at The Moxy Chelsea for my 30th birthday weekend! The rooms were so clean and had even more style and character. All the of staff was great, especially Danny. He gave us great recommendations throughout the weekend and was a great help in booking us another night when we just were having too much fun to leave. I would definitely recommend to anyone staying in NYC.

We came here for the weekend and had to stay additional night, so we chose Moxy and we had a great service and accommodations. I would say the downside is late checkout was at an expense and the bed was not as comfortable. However, everything else was amazing. The view especially

Faimly trip to New York City for the holiday weekend. We wanted a place that was close to midtown but not in and close to SoHo. Loved this property. Perfect location good vibe super nice and helpful staff. Really liked Danny at the front desk. The tokens for a free Prosecco was nice touch. Would recommend and would stay there again.

Great Hotel In The Flower District. Faimly Trip To City. Had a great time in the city and this hotel is central to a lot of areas. We liked the hotel set up. Staff was really nice. Rooftop bar is very cool. It is rope line but as long as hotel gusts are in by 9:00pm they are in, however if you leave after 9:00 you are behind the rope line no preferential treatment. Danny at front desk was really helpful at check in and with area questions. Would defiantly recommend and stay again

review_body: Great staff at the front desk and bar. Made our stay enjoyable. Danielle and Danny helped us get to where we needed to be on a steamy fourth of july weekend. When looking for directions to the west village or to a bar to watch the world cup, they made sure we were comfortable and go to where we needed to go. Grateful for their help.

I booked directly on the Marriott website since I have a member number there(a bit of a price break and free to be a member). I got a standard king room to share with my cousin for one night(we're in our 20's and 30's). I've stayed at some hotels in the Chelsea area, as well as other parts of Manhattan and Brooklyn. Things I did like:- The hotel is easy to find and in the flower district. If you're there early enough, you can check out all the gorgeous flowers. - I found nearby parking to house the car for 24 hrs for a lot less than the hotel charges, you can just search on spothero or parking panda- We were able to store our backpacks in the baggage room on the C level of the hotel. Much better than lugging them around until check in.- I checked in and out on my iphone through the Marriott Bonvoy app. I was able to request more towels and pillows through the app. Super convenient and I was able to "Check in" around 2 and my room was ready around 3. You can do it remotely without being at the hotel and the app alerted me when my room was ready. You use your phone as the key. - The bed was super comfortable Things I really didn't like, so much so that I won't go back:- thin walls. I heard a gaggle of girls outside our room at all the time shouting and laughing. I'm not sure even if they were in the hall or the room next to us. - not enough elevators and they're slow. Plus, you have to use your "key"(in this instance, my phone key) to get to your floor and its hit or miss with the elevator touch key pad. - the 4th floor was loud, dark and had an office building directly across(from the looks through the windows, office is a guess). Do you want to keep the curtain open? You're going to show your bits to the neighbors across the way. - I was aware of the bathroom situation, or so I thought. I knew there were barn doors with frosted glass and that the sink is outside of those spaces in the room. The pain in the neck is: If you want any shred of privacy you'll be hard pressed to find it. If you want to disrobe in the shower, there are no hooks at all. You have to open the door and drop your clothes on the floor. There's nowhere to hold a towel so you again have to slide the door and get it off the floor. Then you have to get dressed in the shower without getting your clothes wet from the floor. This is a ridiculous, awkward design unless you love being naked with whomever you're rooming with. - In the shower there's two pump bottles on the wall: conditioner and hand soap. Yes, it says HAND SOAP. I used the app to request shampoo, he brought more HAND SOAP. I have color treated hair so I'm not going to just slap anything in it to wash it. After a stupidly hot day walking around, this was very frustrating. I didn't bring any hair washing products because I've never encountered a hotel without shampoo. - No complimentary anything. There's Fiji water in the room (5 bucks a bottle). No coffee maker. No small toiletries. No fridge. No microwave.- The room price fluctuates greatly and there's no price guarantee unless you catch the difference within 24 hours. I don't like the gambling factor of cost fluctuations. There's no Marriott member loyalty to adjust the cost. I think overall this hotel is designed for aesthetics, not for common sense use. People say "unique" but I think hotels like this in the area are a dime a dozen. They're all trying to be cool but lacking the functionality. The bathroom in the room is annoying with a bad design. While I appreciate the use and convenience of the app for certain things, its very impersonal. The only person I spoke to was to ask about where to store bags and she wasn't welcoming or friendly.

Great hotel location for access to attractions around NYC. Super comfortable beds and great views from our room. Wonderful, open atrium with comfortable seating. Access to many subways within several blocks of hotel to head uptown or downtown. Chelsea neighborhood has some character. Would have liked to have a small refrigerator in room.

Hospitality, customer service, attention to detail, energised and upbeat staff personalities, gorgeous lobby garden and 2nd floor decor, comfy beds and ample size bathroom. 35th floor restaurant and bar is a must-see. Great location!

We stayed at moxy for 2 nights. Had a great view of empire state building at night. Bed felt great, modern fun design of room. Complimentary glass of champagne at gorgeous bar was a nice finishing touch. Would highly recommend and look forward to trying out other locations!

We spent a long weekend and found this hotel to have everything we needed. It's a block from the 28th Street station and made it very easy to get around. The hotel opened in February and still has its newness. The second and top floor have bar spaces. The rooms are creatively designed and include some fun features to take advantage of it's NYC sized rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a front of the building on the 22nd floor and had relatively quiet evenings-this also gave us some nice city views. We would stay in this flower district location again.  If you fly into Newark, its easy to take the train into Penn station and then the 1 train one stop to 28th and walk one block.

We recently visited the moxy Chelsea whilst in NYC for a show. We had 4 fantastic nights in the hotel and would love to stay again. A very stylish modern hotel with friendly staff and clean rooms. A busy lively bar area which serves food and has a DJ playing at night. There is a lovely looking restaurant which we didnt eat in(but did in the bar). A nightclub is on the roof but we didnt visit as we had our 2 teenagers with us.A great hotel which is ideally placed for a lot of major attractions(we were there for Madison Square garden) and is a very short walk from Penn station.

We have stayed at the Moxy Chelsea multiple times since it has opened. All were for fun weekend stays in NYC for theatre events, concerts and general fine dining excursions. Excellent hotel and customer service! Location is fantastic, rooms are beautifully designed, clean and comfortable. Front desk staff always make us feel welcome and like "V.I.P."s!

While the rooms are small, they are well-designed with nice amenities. We had no issue with street noise, likely in part because NY streets are much quieter than the avenues. But what really made the difference for us was the service. My daughter contracted food poisoning while in NY, and the staff did absolutely everything they could to help. extended her stay, found another room with two queens for her sister and me, contacted the hotel doctor, and checked in with us a few times during our stay. All this during Pride weekend! Sometimes hip comes with attitude - Moxy delivered hip with caring and compassion.

We’ve been for a party on the higher floor with an amazing view on NYCGood drink cozy ambient and great organizationNearby Chelsea one of the coolest neighbor of Manhattan easy to reach by taxi, Uber or LiftRecommended

First time staying at Moxy. The service and friendly employees are what makes everything the best. Rooms are well designed and they have every essential needs of a guest. Keep yourself open minded about your expectations especially about the design of the rooms. Personally I loved everything about the hotel especially bar and the restaurant must try. I definitely recommend this place and I would like to stay again for my next NYC trips.

Not all properties are catering towards or good for families, so definitely want to say that I understand if this property is geared towards more hip, young, single people. But I feel like even for that crowd, this hotel has some challenges. At $500/night, I was surprised this is no bell service. They give you a cart and you go it alone. We used valet parking--although they try their best, given the very narrow and congested street they are on, the valet parking situation is super chaotic. It took us over 35 minutes to get our car. On the positive side, the restaurant on the ground floor is great--beautiful, good services, good food. The lounge on the 2nd floor was also perfect for our purposes. We had a big group so we just grabbed a large table in the corner and ordered a ton of very tasty pizzas. There was a cute indoor bocce table to use. Service at the restaurants and front desk were quite good, and they do manage well in a very chaotic/demanding/loud environment. The rooms are super spartan and very small. I felt somewhat like I was camping, as little folding chairs/tables are hung from pegs on the walls, etc. However, my kids thought the room was great as it was quite different from the 5 star properties we were staying at elsewhere in NYC. The view from the room was great. But the sink is a metal stand right next to the front door. Noise did not seem to be an issue--we had neither street noise nor noise from surrounding rooms even though I believe the hotel was nearly full. We were disappointed not to be able to enjoy the rooftop bar as they do not allow under 21 up there, even hotel guests. There was massive confusion in the morning as we called down to ask what breakfast options were, and they told us either the rooftop bar or 2nd floor. We tried to get to the rooftop bar by elevator but housekeeping told us the elevators were broken and not able to go all the way up, so they directed us to the services stairs, which were dark and weird. Of course when we got to the roof, staff told us breakfast hasn't been served up there in a really long time, and directed us to the ground floor. Anyway, I'm sure if you're looking for a fun scene and not worried about amenities or parking, that this could be a very enjoyable property. For me, at that rate, I was just expecting nicer rooms and more full service.

I just had the perfect 8 stay at The Moxy Chelsea. Firstly, the hotel has just opened at the beginning of the year, so everything was nice and new, but no signs of any teething issues. The hotel is located in the Flower District in Chelsea, so central to pretty much everything. The hotel is unique and cool on every level, not too big either. I loved the coffee shop on the ground level and the guys working there remembered my order and name which was really special. The 2nd floor bar is great to visit any time of day. It’s such a beautiful space, so great to have delicious pizza for lunch and drinks at night. It also has a great work space, perfect for catching up on any business matters etc. Again, the staff were friendly and efficient. The Fleur Room, top floor rooftop bar, boasting 360 degree views of NY, is sensational. The decor is stunning and it also houses a unique disco ball that once hung in the infamous Vertigo Club in LA in the day. The Feroce restaurant on the ground floor is a brilliant, buzzing venue, serving delicious Italian cuisine. I actually celebrated my birthday here with a group of friends and had a great night.My room, a city view corner room was great. I had expansive views of Downtown and New Jersey. I spent endless hours just staring out of the floor to ceiling windows when I woke in the morning. The rooms are compact, there’s no denying that, but the layout has been carefully and cleverly designed to make the most of every bit of space. The bed was so comfortable and I slept really well. There is a great fold up table and chair that hangs on the wall when not needed. There isn’t a wardrobe, but, but there are lots of hooks on the wall with coat hangers. I needed more and they were delivered within 5 minutes. There is also some storage under the bed. If two people were staying in the room with big suitcases, it could get tricky. The shower was lovely and large, but the vanity was in the actual room. There was plenty of space under the vanity which I used to stow my luggage. The only thing I missed initially was coffee making facilities and a mini fridge. I do like to have a coffee upon waking, but I soon got used to grabbing one in the cafe. Personally I didn’t need a fridge as I was out all the time anyway. I mentioned this to the staff and they advised me they were looking into different options. Overall, the room was perfect for me, very comfortable, clean and beautifully furnished.I would really like to compliment all the staff. From Paul the Captain, who took care of my reservation before my arrival to the all the front desk guys, especially Christian, Danny and Marvin. They made me feel so welcome and special, assisted me when needed and were always up for a chat. I have to say a special thank you to Christian. On the day of my birthday, when I was out, he wrote birthday greetings on my room window and knowing I was having pre-dinner birthday drinks with friends on the 2nd floor bar before dining at Feroce, he left me drink chips so I could shout my friends a drink. Now that was special! It made my day.I can not recommend this hotel enough. Thank you to all the Moxy Crew for making my stay wonderful! I can’t wait to come back! X

Traveling for work, I stayed at the Moxy Chelsea for 2 nights in April 2019, just a few weeks after they first opened. I was delighted to see that Marriott is getting into the Boutique Hotel scene. CHECKINThe "lobby" is discrete, and hidden behind a lovely flower cart that you walk thru in the foyer. Walk toward the yellow neon sign, and that is where you checkin. The attendant upgraded my room to a high floor (floor 25) in a Wheel Chair access room, so my room ended up being HUGE. I was given a wooden token to claim a happy hour drink for free in the lobby bar which was a very nice touch!ROOMMy room was supremely well designed and cleaned. It was equipped with a wall of accessories from a laptop table, to a luggage stand..etc. The vanity was a "farm sink" just inside the door. The beds were comfortable, however my room was terrible hot both nights-- I think the A/C was not working well, making it very hard to sleep.BATHROOMThe bathroom was in a separate room and was HUGE (because it was handicapped access). It had a large soaking tub, tiled with cute words like "get wild". All of the hardware was matte black. Very chic. FACILITIESThere is a lovely lobby bar on the second floor that you can claim your free welcome drink at. There is also a rooftop bar that I was unfortunately unable to visit- it seems to access the rooftop you must go thru the cafe on the bottom floor/entrance.The location is not what I would necessarily call Chelsea proper. It's more like Koreatown, which is totally fine. I would definitely stay here again, but make sure my A/C worked well next time.

After spending a weekend at the (newly built) Moxy Chelsea, I have to compliment the mgmt and staff for a wonderful stay.The 2 bunk bed arrangement option in my room was super useful and the design is really cool (and fun)Would I prefer a more private toilet though? Absolutely.The bonus of being able to have an (expensive) drink at the sexy rooftop bar in the hotel is awesome.For some reason I had to request for housekeeping to visit the room when they didn’t come during the day.. wasn’t a big dealAll in all a great visit and a super location for your visit to NYC! PS Parking : while there is no parking at the Moxy ($65 /day valet takes your car to an Ipark garage somewhere and you’ll wait 30 mins to get your car back) there is a SP+ parking garage (800 6th Avenue) that’s a 2 min walk away which I’d recommend checking out first.

I travel to NYC for business and stayed at this Chelsea location Moxy. This was my first Moxy experience. It is unique. The staff was wonderful. The rooms are small but efficient- you can request a refrigerator but they are not typically in the rooms. There is a hydration station in the gym and quality gym equipment. The gym was also exceptionallyClean which is pleasant! Unfortunately the rooftop was closed for the days I was there due to an even so I will have to experience that another time. The hotel did not offer any type of points or room credit and also did not notify me of this closure prior to my arrival which I found disappointing. Again this was my first stay at a Moxy. The restaurant located in the lobby was so chic and had great servers and menu options! I also loved that there is a little flower/gift market in the lobby with good quality items! Will likely stay again for the view but will definitely verify that I will be able to utilize ALL of the accommodations prior to arrival.

I stayed two nights here on business. It was a good experience and I would stay here again. Super clean, modern hotel. Very hip vibe. While the lobby was loud and bustling my room on the 18th floor was very quiet. Room was very small, even by NYC standards. I was by myself, but even one more person in the room would have been crowded. No bathroom privacy but with just me it was no big deal. Shower did leak into the room and toilet area. No coffee maker in the room but I hear you can get free coffee somewhere in the hotel (I never found it but I didn’t try very hard). There’s a grocery/pharmacy across the street where you can get anything you need (don’t need to spend $5 on water). There’s also no room service here but plenty of restaurants and take out options nearby. The TV was great and WiFi was fast and easy. Being in the middle of so many flower shops was lovely! Easy walking distance to many places and close subway access. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

I can not say enough great things about this hotel! I have stayed here numerous times for business and have enjoyed each and every stay. The front desk staff is extremely friendly and welcoming every time I checked-in (even every time I walked into the hotel I was greeted with a smile). The front desk staff are one of the many reasons I continued to choose the Moxy in Chelsea during my business trips, on top of being friendly they were very attentive to all guests. The rooms are comfortable and so clean. The bar on the 2nd floor and on the roof have great menus (both food and drink). Lastly, the location is perfect. Right in the heart of the flower district and within walking distance to so many NYC attractions and restaurants. Stay here, you will love it!!

We stayed this past weekend at the Moxy Chelsea and really loved the style, decor and design of the whole building.Pros:-Convenient location to everything you need in NY-Great Bar with friendly staff-Free morning Coffee-Bed is very comfortable-Quiet rooms, besides the odd door slam in the corridor-Great use of the small space, hooks everywhere and storage available under the bed-Brand new building so everything is clean and modernCons:-Room is TINY.-Water leaks from Shower into the bedroom-Zero privacy when showering or using Toilet-Sink drains very slowly-Musty/ moldy smell in the room-Elevator wait can be long at peak timesI think overall if you were in the city for 1-2 nights this would serve you well for what you need but any longer i would seriously consider staying elsewhere.

I was extremely impressed with the property, people and experience. We intended to stay at a Marriott Luxury or Premium Collection. My daughter saw the bunk beds and was sold. My wife and I were very comfortable and liked the use of space and layout.The Feroce Bar is a very comfortable place to relax or work. We enjoyed breakfast at the Feroce Caffé and recommend visiting the Fleur Room (adults only, opens at 5pm) on the 35th floor for a 360-degree views of Manhattan.If you want to be centrally located and away from Times Square this location is perfect. We walked to The Vessel at Hudson Yards and even down to Soho if you’re up for some exercise.

We stayed two nights at the Moxy NYC Chelsea. Our room was facing the Empire State Building which was really cool at night. We visited the bar and had a great time. The music wasn't too loud where you couldn't talk to one another. Overall, a really cool hotel.

We visited Moxy NYC Chelsea during our stay in New York. The location could not be faulted! We were close to great bars and restaurants, the subway, Chelsea Market and were able to walk to Central Park and Times Square. The front desk staff were amazing and so good and were more than accommodating.Rooms were very small so we had to ensure everything was packed up each time we needed to grab some clothes out for the day as their was no wardrobe as the rooms were small but all rooms in New York are small and the set out still worked really well. Only minor things we could fault during our stay was that the rooftop bar accidently charged our card twice for cocktails we had there but we didn't notice until the next day and didn't know how to approach it so left it. Also the housekeeping hadn't filled up the bodywash when doing the rooms so we ended up leaving a note to try and get more and they had missed filling up the bottled water after we consumed one (which cost $5 per bottle) so by the time housekeeping came again the next day they charged us again so by the end of the trip a few extra bottles were added on. We could have said something and I'm sure it would have been fixed, but that was the only small things we could fault. Other than that the experience was amazing!

Excellent hotel with great amenities. The staff is great and very welcoming. If you are wanting a nice quiet sleep in the middle of NYC, this is the spot! If you need anything, just ask, the team is always going above and beyond. For that reason, I make this a destination hotel when traveling for work.

Really fun design. The staff was very helpful. The bar/cafe Feroce connected was delightful. The host was so upbeat and friendly - the food was delicious and the space was very pretty. The location in the flower district was fun and pretty (maybe except when delivery trucks were in the area) Loved it overall and would definitely stay again.

Louisville, Kentucky, United States

review_body: Nice hotel in flower district of Chelsea. It has a hip, minimalist flow to it. The rooms are on the small side but probably normal for NY city. Given the size of the room, I'd recommend it for a short stay - it might be a bit tight if you're staying a week or longer (e.g., no place to put multiple luggage, no real sitting area, etc). The staff are incredibly helpful and nice and the bar area is artsy and funky. The rooftop bar is supposed to be really nice -- and the new "it" spot for late night. We unfortunately were not able to experience it as they had a private Tony Awards event there the night we stay. Overall, really nice hotel that we'd definitely come back to the next time we're in NY city.

Very creative design, super cozy room, and awesome city views. Drinks and appetizers at the bar were excellent and the rooftop was a lot of fun, great music and fun vibe. Would highly recommend to anyone!

This is a fun hip hotel in a great location. Staff is friendly and informative. The roof is beautiful and the views from the rooms are great. There is a lot of bars and restaurants in the area. Close to the flatiron. Linda, Danny and Avery were energetic and fun!

I stayed to see the hotel due to its nominations for design awards and it is very well designed, fabulous public space, light and bright comfortable rooms, beautifully detailed. The rooftop bar has amazing views, great place for a cocktail. The ground floor restaurant is a vibrant buzzing, beautifully designed, with great food and service to match.

I hesitated between 4 and 5 stars here. 5: bed, shower, amazing view, location, silent rooms, bar & facilities. 4: no free water even if you are Platinum, no feather pillows in the rooms. Also no closets but really, who cares about that. This may have become my go-to Marriott property in the city. I will definitely be back.

We chose to stay at the Moxy as it appeared modern, quirky, reviews were great and it's central location for our first trip to New York was perfect.My husband had contacted the hotel, prior to our arrival, advising them of our trip to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. To our absolute delight, we were upgraded to a room with an amazing city view of downtown Manhattan and balloons and rose petals had been thoughtfully, set out on our bed. We were also given tokens for money off in the restaurants and complimentary glasses of Prosecco, which were gratefully received!The room was stunning - modernly furnished with functional decor and amazing views. The shower was brilliant, as was the comfort of the bed. A hairdryer, clothes steamer and good quality toiletries for the shower were also provided. Our only addition to the room was a travel kettle which we took with us to make a drink in the mornings, as we'd read these weren't provided.The hotel is situated in the middle of the Flower District, so on arriving and setting off from the hotel, we were surrounded by beautiful flowers, shrubs and plants all along the street. The hotel is centrally situated in mid-town Manhattan, so was an ideal base for exploring the city (The Empire State Building, Times Square etc only a 15 minute walk away). There is also a Metro at the end of the street for trips further afield.The food at the various restaurants in the hotel, was excellent, our favourite being breakfast served in the cafe on the ground floor. Unfortunately, we weren't able to eat in the main restaurant as it was fully booked, so booking ahead is recommended.The staff were friendly, accommodating and happily answered any questions we had. Overall, we loved the style of the hotel, the location was perfect for exploring the city, food was great and staff went above and beyond in making our anniversary special! Highly recommended.

We had to events in the city and instead of driving back and forth we decided to stay at the Moxy. The location is great and it's brad new. The rooms as small but stylish. We got two rooms because we are family of 5. They only have 2 connecting rooms on each floor. The double bed rooms are located on the corner of each floor so there are only 4 of them per floor and they are not connecting. The hotel isn't really made for families. I would recommend it for a couple of single.

The entire establishment is gorgeous and I loved the room so much. The second floor, rooftop, and restaurant next door were all amazing— I even showed my NYC local and she plans to bring her friends back to enjoy the bars! Would absolutely stay again, and would recommend anyone I know. The views were great, the use of the small space was amazing, and just generally loved the hotel.

I was a little nervous about this property before getting there because it looked from the pictures that the rooms are very small, there wasn't a desk and I assumed the bathroom would be ultra-tiny. I was very pleasantly surprised on all counts. Check-in was quick and friendly. Yes, the room is small (almost all rooms in NYC are small!), but it's laid out very nicely. There's not a closet, but for a couple of nights stay there is ample room to hang your clothes on the wall with the hangers they provide. The bed was extremely comfortable - probably the highlight of the stay. As "small" as the room is, the shower is very spacious! While there's not a desk, they have a little table and chair that folds up and hangs on the wall. I never thought I would be able to use it comfortably, but again, I was wrong. The breakfast cafe was very good, and their 2nd floor bar was great to do some work in the morning where it is set up more like a coffee bar. I will be back!

This very attractive boutique hotel is wonderfully placed in the flower district. Easy subway access and much within walking distance. The staff was exceptionally nice, the room was very clean and attractive, the bed was very comfortable, and the price is moderately reasonable. The rooftop bar is stunning (although does not allow anyone under 21, so my teenagers could not enjoy the view). For a hotel of this small size, I thought it had a good number of nice amenities as well. We had a king bed, and I thought the layout of the tiny room was ingenious: the sink was in the bedroom and the toilet and shower had separate sliding doors (frosted glass) that opened right into the room. I loved the use of space, however, it is not much for privacy. Some might find this off-putting. My only complaint was that for myself AND my traveling companions in a different room there were never enough towels. We were shortchanged the day of arrival, housekeeping took those towels and didn't replace any the second day, and the third day we were back to being one towel shy. The fourth day they left us with extra! They were always happy to supply more when I asked, I just think there staff on my floor was a bit confused. Also, my friends sink drained slowly, and after reporting it and being assured that it would be fixed, it never was. These things aside, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Newish, clean, retro accessories -- nice change from old, dusty hotels living on their laurels. Refreshing area, with florist shops on the sidewalk; heart of Chelsea -- and close to where our daughter lives. Will become our go-to place! Doesn't pretend to be five-stars with huge lobby, etc. But adjoining Italian restaurant and bar are a scene, so there's everything you need without overdoing it or being pretentious. Which is why I give it five.

loved the room! decor so unique.. the shower is out of the world! rainshower. tiled floor.. you have to see the sinks... so cool. Italian restaurant next door was great.. fantastic wine selection. perfect location, literally so easy to get to

I stayed here last month as family was visiting from out of town and absolutely loved this new property!! As someone that has worked in the industry, the atmosphere and staff of this hotel were amazing!! Shout out to Christian for assisting me at the front desk - he made our welcome that much more special! Awesome hospitality!
