New York City, New York

review_body: I had a great 3 night stay. Fab views of the Empire State Building from my room, the rooms are on the small side and quarters are tight but they are well thought through and practical as well as cool general aesthetic.

Lovely flower smell from the entrance is going to welcome you! Casual and friendly service will be provided from the Front Desk. Highlight is the room!! Unbelievablly beautiful room! Very stylish and extremely cozy and comfortable bed with stunning city view. However, it was bit difficult to organize my stuff (No luggage rack & no closet) because of the size of room. Very limited space.

I just returned from New York having stayed 7 nights in this cool new hotel. Everything about this hotel & New York was amazing. My daughter & son & my older brother were on their first ever trip to The Big Apple and none of us wanted to leave . This hotel is chic in a brillant location in Central Manhattan. I can't praise the staff from housekeeping, maintenance, bar staff, waiters, and front desk enough for their friendly & helpful attitude towards us. Special mention goes out to the asmazing Keneisha, Tiffanie, Adam, Marvin, Linda & & all the pther amazing Moxy Staff ...

Modern hotel and nice bar, however, there are soiled stained towels in the stairwells blocking the fire exit, slow lifts, waited half an hour to get into our room due to the mobile lock running out of battery.Overall pretty disappointed and interested to see what the next 4 days holds....

I had the opportunity to stay for 3 days. Keneisha is one of the best personalities I’ve meet through Marriot. I’ll be staying here whenever I’m in New York. Appreciate your amazing grace. See you guys again soon!

Loved the Moxy NYC Chelsea. Great location, very comfortable beds and adorable rooms. The 2nd floor was a great retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. I loved the great view from my room. My only complaint was the lack of umbrellas in the lobby; I"m used to a hotel having loaners.

stayed here on a whim for staycation. Overall, I can see what the hotel is trying to do in terms of concept and how they can appeal to.... specific generation of people. To that end, the hotel does it rather well. If you have the right expectation for the basic level hip hotel (think Ace hotel or sort), then you will be satisfied with what you get for the money you pay. This ain't St Regis but I can see myself coming back. Con:tiny tiny room not the cleanest roomno shampoo (this is absurd but I can see this being some accident. It gotta be)AC makes loud noise not all power outlets workPro:amazing view- if you get the room with city view. i think it's worth it especially for the priceprice- price point is amazing. don't know what else is sayclever interior- I mentioned about tiny tiny room. some collapsible furniture makes it less badlocation- it's not bad really. Nomad itself may be lacking (yah it's not quite in Chelsea) but easy to get to anywhere

The room was quiet and the view was as promised. The staff downstairs was very helpful. The service in the restaurant needed a little improvement as I had to ask to have my table cleaned from the people who were there before.

I loved this hotel! Great location in the flower district. Rooms are modern and clean on the smaller side but very comfortable. The rooftop bar is amazing and very "instragramable." Would definitely stay there again!

From Penn station to Moxy Chelsea is a 7 minute walk, through the flower district. The entrance is beautiful and smells wonderfull with all the flowers from Putnam & Putnam. The check-in area is very trendy. We got a very, very warm and nice welcome from Marvin, and also from Kenisha. Thank you both! We travel as a family, with our two children of 20 and 15 years, and decided to book a room with 2 double beds. We got a room on the 30th floor, with an amazing, breathtaking view. The room is small. We travel only with hand luggage, so small suitcases, but there is no place to store them. So you have to put them somewhere and the are in the way because of the size of the room. There are no closets, to store you can use the draws underneath the beds and you also can hang lots of your things on the big coat rack, left and right from the lcd tv. The beds are lovely, and how convenient to have wall-plugs with charges. So no need to bring your own plug-in.The shower is spacious and has great shampoo and conditioner. Smells delicious! Even the time waiting for the elevator is nice, with good music on the background.The rooftop bar is beautiful but the kids weren't allowed, unfortunately, it is a club for 21+. The bar Feroce on the second floor I can recommend, nice vibe, great design. Next to the hotel entrance there is the caffe and restaurant Feroce. You can sit and have breakfast, but also get a coffee to go, or a focaccia for a snack. The restaurant we did not try, but it looks nice and with a good Italian menu.I will definitely go back to Moxy Chelsea, the ambiance is really nice, and feels good. We liked the design, and the trendy urban vibe.

Really enjoyed this hotel. Haven't stayed in any room like this before. Feels fresh, modern, cozy, and not dated. Really enjoyed the Penthouse and 2nd floor bar. Great vibe allover, just slow elevators.

The Moxy NYC Chelsea reflects the way we all hope, as guests, to be treated. The staff is terrific; the rooms are clean; the location is within a walk of some of my fave spots in the city including some of the great restaurants...Eataly, Gramercy Tavern (awesome) and the original Shake Shack. It's in the heart of the flower wholesale business so early every morning the street is loaded with buckets of flowers and potted plants...orchids abound. FUN!

Great modern, efficient and fun hotel.Am business traveler and needed a well located, modern hotel in amazing location. Moxy exceeded expectations. And check in and check out incredibly efficient, especially for time-crunched busy exec.Highly recommend!

Stayed here last weekend with my boyfriend for a city trip. I had initial room shock to how small it was, but it was very functional and the views from the room with floor to ceiling corner windows were absolutely stunning. The room was comfortable and was perfect for a 2 night stay. Given that it was brand new, everything was exceptionally clean and the bed was very comfortable.Staff was friendly as well! We used the gym both mornings which was fairly large but lacking equipment and almost all free weights and machines were in use. We didn’t get a chance to try either of the restaurants but we went to the rooftop bar and it was stunning! The views were amazing. All in all, it was a great hotel and I’d definitely stay here again!

Moxy is a contemporary little nugget of a hotel that sits at the heart of a bustling district. and because its a small establishment, it was a bit of a struggle having came from a long work trip and didn't had the luxury of travelling light. We had 5 big luggages and it was quite a struggle having to lug them from the car to the reception area and into the rooms cause the person serving you at the reception, is unfortunately also the same guy bringing the luggages to the room. And because the rooms are compact, unpacking requires a degree of thoughtfulness cause you will walk into things lying around carelessly given that tiny space.Toilets are segregated away from the room by a mere frosted glass and you can actually see the silhouette of the person sitting at the toilet bowl doing his/her thang and I am guessing it might be quite an uncomfortable sight if you are sharing room with a friend/colleague. Side from that, Moxy spots a very sophisticated interior aced with a bar that looks incredible both in the day and in the night. And for those of you who are feeling a bit peckish and don't wish to eat in the hotel, the all American fast food giant with the Golden Arches sit just across the hotel.

All the positives first. The staff is inviting and friendly. The bed, very comfortable. But I didn't want to stay in summer camp. The room is the smallest I've ever stayed in. The sink, which looks like a restaurant slop sink is in the room, not in the bathroom.The storage provided is in the form of hooks hanging on the wall. The lighting is industrial. On this central block of the flower district, they are cramming in hotel after hotel. Clearly, the word cramming is relevant considering the size of everything. Maybe for 20 somethings with limited experience at hotels, this place seems cool. For the rest of us, maybe not so much.

review_body: We had a 4 night stay at the Moxy Chelsea. We were very impressed by the hotel. It was extremely clean, very well appointed and the staff were very pleasant.The rooms are not large, but suited us well as we traveled light. We requested a city view king room on a high floor. We had a terrific view of the city, the Empire State Building was right there. The room was comfortable, quiet and visually appealing. Loved the shower!The 2nd floor lounge is absolutely beautiful. What an amazing interior design concept. Could hang out there all day!The hotel is on 28th street between 6th and 7th Ave. Subway on 28th and 7th and Broadway. Just a few minutes walk. 28th Street is lined with Flower shops, so pretty when heading out.It's also central to everything. We walked everywhere. Chelsea Market and the High Line were a 20 minute walk, Time Square the same. Macy's and a ton of shopping 10 minute walk.We had drinks and Breakfast at Feroce which were good but pricey, but what isn't in NYC?Would definitely recommend this hotel, it was a very comfortable enjoyable stay.

Although the Moxy isn’t necessarily a suitable business hotel, the Chelsea property offers enough to convince me to overlook some business shortcomings: no closet, no iron (just a steamer), only three hangars, no mini-fridge, and a barely comfortable folding chair and table. However, it’s quite new, is fresh and clean, with great service and a nice gym with good potential that isn’t realized just yet.The queen bedroom has a great view on the correct side of the hotel, but on the incorrect side, your window opens up to another building right in your face. Not a huge deal, but it’s worth requesting the front side of the hotel. The bathroom is divided into a water closet and a shower, and both are a nice size for a New York hotel. Although the overall room size is cramped, it’s not terrible, especially given the fact that the property is newer. One small detail I appreciated, and this might sound strange, but in many hotels with worn sheets and bedding, I have rolled over in the night and ended up with a small abrasion on my elbow from sheets that, over time, have ended up with a bit of a sand paper effect. This even happens at nice properties, of the 3.5-4-star variety. Not the case at the Moxy Chelsea – the property is new enough to not have worn sheets!I did not use the restaurant, but it’s not a full-service place, from what I could tell – light meals/drinks only. There’s a nice bar on the 2nd floor, and the gym and office area, as well as the luggage check is in the basement. The gym is pretty spacious for a hotel, and there is standard equipment for a gym of this type, but it looks like the planning wasn’t ideal. There is quite a bit of wasted wall and floor space where a kettlebell rack, or perhaps a squat rack, could be placed. I hope the Moxy has plans to expand their equipment because it would be great if the Chelsea had things like kettlebells – you’ll find these in the Times Square property.Overall, a nice, hip and trendy property. It’s a good place for most vacationers/partiers, and decent for business – fairly versatile. I would return since it’s newer than the Times Square version but needs some additional improvements.

I stayed at the Moxy in Chelsea with three friends for the weekend. The rooms are fantastic, location is perfect and the staff could not be more helpful! Especially Danny - who really went above and beyond to ensure we had an incredible trip!

The staff was constantly helpful, even during my late PM arrival, I was amazed at how welcoming Sheana was at such a late hour. The room was fantastic and the ambiance was relaxing, had a great gym for its size as well.

I had the privilege of staying in the newly opened Moxy NYC Chelsea this past weekend. I spent the weekend celebrating my birthday with two friends from out of town. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the hotel was only an 8 min walk from the train station. This hotel is new and beautiful. It’s located in the cutest neighborhood in Chelsea called the Flower District. They even have a flower shop in the front entrance (pic below). Upon check in I was greeted by Marvin at the front desk. He was very welcoming and accommodating along with the rest of the staff at the hotel. They went out of their way to make sure we had the best stay. The room was comfortable and modern, we had a great view and we were close to great restaurants and clubs in the Meatpacking District. I will definitely be back and I can’t recommend this hotel and location enough!

This is a new hotel from the Marriott “Moxy” brand — small and simpler but high quality rooms, and great restaurants and public areas. It is targeted at a bit more of a young/party crowd than me (200+ night per year upscale to luxury business traveler), but I wanted to try something new and liked it.Rooms are small but efficient (no large furniture, just a bed and a sink), but with a relatively large shower, and overall not too bad for NYC standards. The lobby is nice, but where the hotel really shines are the coffee bar and Italian restaurant.Overall, I’d recommend this to anyone who is coming to NYC to go out and do stuff.

New hidden gem located in the flower district.Long weekend mother daughter stay.A visual beauty through out the common areas oriented to fine textiles etc.The rooms provided the comfort needed. 15th floor view of the city spectacular A professional efficient staff who truly appear proud of this hidden jam.Thank you to Kenisha for being part of many that made us eager to return.

We booked this hotel for the bed arrangements so no one would have to share as there was 6 of us travelling. We had two rooms booked, a bunk bed room and a double bed room. The girls in the bunk bed room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. We had a view of McDonald’s.Marriott hotel guests, this is not what you expect from the brand, moxy is supposed to be a pared down European style hotel.The pros-brand new and very clean-Beautiful lobby with flowers -Friendly staff-Comfortable beds Cons-too far from main tourist attractions, there are dozens of great hotels closer-Zero bathroom privacy in double bed room, you can see everything in the bathroomwith the frosted glass (drywall would have been better!)-the trendy sinks do not drain, very bad design flaw!-rooms are small, definitely not suitable for a family of four -expensive for what you get-no fridge-no toiletries other than soap, shampoo and conditioner -no coffee maker I would definitely not recommend this hotel to families. I would recommend it for very young hip travellers, maybe under 30’s only that are travelling together but only for the bunk bed rooms. My last hotel stay in Manhattan was the Lotte New York Palace and this obviously doesn’t compare! Sorry Moxy Chelsea but I won’t be back and would not recommend to anyone I know.

I had an amazing time at the new Moxy Hotel in Chelsea this past week. Beautiful hotel and comfortable room. Smells like flowers as soon as you walk in the lobby! Location is very convenient for exploring different areas of the city. Christian assisted me with my stay and he was so polite and helpful! Thank you to him for making my stay even more enjoyable. I will definitely be back!

All perfectBrand new hotel, very modern. View from hotel room (and rooftop bar) are just amazing.The area is beautifull (in the flower street, a real contract with new york) and perfect for visiting NY.Employees were very nice and helpfullI warmly recommand this hotel

My sisters and I did an overnighter in Manhattan and stayed at the Moxy. It was Perfect! Upon our arrival, there were bottles of water and champagne glasses for the four us to begin our celebration! We had the room with the four bunk beds and it was fabulous! The beds, comforters, and pillows were so comfortable, none of us wanted to get up for brunch the next day! The water pressure in the shower was awesome and there were plenty of towels for us all! I highly recommend! Only complaint was that we were not permitted entrance into the Rooftop bar on Saturday night because we were not on the guest list (rather disappointing) ... especially being hotel guests.

review_body: Very cool boutique hotel! Service was outstanding! Rooftop bar is excellent! A very different experience in a great part of the city! Food is excellent!! Very good locayto sites! Room has unique features!

I'd prefer to give this a 4.5 than 5 as I had the ill fortune of getting a cold shower one morning, but solicited everyone else in my group and I guess it was just me so will let it slide. more on the positive side of the review however I'd have to say the service/staff were super-friendly, there was tons to do just in the hotel as the 2nd floor atrium's and bar were great, well stocked and had great staff as well. The Rooftop is also a must do if you get a bit better weather than we did.otherwise, the rooms were clean, unique and decently laid out given the size. Best part I think though was how quiet they were which is tough for NYC. I'd do it again!

No hot water for three straight days in my room. They kept saying they would fix it but didn’t.One night at midnight they called and said I had a visiter. I reply that I don’t and that they woke me up. They sent him up and he knocked on my door at 12:20am and woke me again.Then the next AM they had someone knocking on every door of my floor at 7:50am waking me up again!Finally they fixed it right before I left.

We are a family of 4, teenage children ages 16 and 13, a boy and a girl. Our 2 bed room was too small for the 4 of us, no place for our 4 suitcase, and no closet, really not fit for 4 adults. The shower has a sliding transparent glass door which might be problematic for teenagers with their parents. Another disappointing thing was when we checked out and asked for a taxi, we were told that since the hotel had its own driving service, they would not order a taxi, needless to say that the hotel service is twice more expensive than a taxi, so we had to go out to the street with all the suitcases and try to catch a NY cab ourself. We had the same problem with the hotel parking service, the crew refused to help us when we asked about the nearby parking lots, and we had to use the expensive hotel's parking service. On the good side, this is a new hotel, very trendy, nicely decorated. The stuff are welcoming and generous. The atmosphere in the hotel is very positive, feels like a never ending party, and the location is amazing.I will recommend this hotel, but only if you travel light and without children.

No closet, no space, not quiet, no desk to work from. Don't stay here if you are on business or need space to relax and work. This hotel is more suited for party goers and has a nice club to serve that purpose.

We recently stayed at the Moxy in Chelsea while visiting NYC for college visits. We picked this hotel because of its central location to both Fordham Lincoln Center and NYU. We had never stayed at a Moxy prior to this visit but it’s price point was mid range and the location so ideal that we decided to give it a try. My high school senior and I were both pleasantly surprised by our selection. The hotel has a modern industrial look that is softened by the breathtaking fresh flowers and beautiful fabrics. The rooms were small, like most rooms in NYC, but not cramped and the large windows made it feel larger than it was. Beds and linens were great as well. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and professional and made our stay very enjoyable. The free morning coffee and glass of Prosecco were an added bonus!

My stay at the Moxy hotel in Chelsea was wonderful! The hotel is absolutely stunning. What made it extra special was the woman who checked me in. While I don’t know what her name is, she remembered my name and called me by name every time she saw me in the hotel throughout my stay. I also loved getting the free glass of Prosecco at the bar. Not to mentioned bring surrounded by beautiful flowers everywhere you turn.I will be back!

The room we stayed in seemed to have a prison motif. There was absolutely no privacy in the bathroom which was embarrassing and outrageous! There is a sliding glass door that separates the glass bathroom area from the two beds in our room. No closets only hooks and no space at all for suitcases! The slot in the door looked just like the ones the prison guards slide the food into the inmates room on TV. The tile in the bathroom spells out grow-up!While the beds are comfortable, a hotel with no bathroom privacy is not for me. It ruined our stay here! This is definitely a hotel for millennials with no expectations of privacy or modesty. I am shocked anyone would design a room like the one we stayed in!

The Moxy was the designated hotel for a recent conference I attended. I would not stay there again. Although it is in a great location, it tries so very hard to be trendy that it is just plain uncomfortable. The room was tiny, and the floor was so gritty I had to leave my socks on to keep my feet clean. I realize that since I’m in my 50s I’m not the target audience for this place, but the floors should be clean no matter what the theme is. There is no closet, so the only place to hang your clothes are on pegs along side the TV. It made it feel like laundry day in a college dorm. The sink is so shallow you have to be careful not to overflow it while washing your face. The staff, however, was great. Very helpful, regardless of the hour.

I had a wonderful stay at Moxy Chelsea! Friendly staff, trendy room, great location with easy access to the subway, amazing views from the rooftopbar, high quality Italian food at the restaurant and a nice, laid-back vibe at the 2nd floor bar/lounge area (great for drinks with friends or simply to hang out while finishing work on your laptop). I’d recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great time in NYC.

Me and my friend decided to stay here since it was new and we love it. It was in a perfect location with restaurants, cafes, drug stores, and metro on each end of the block. Even within the hotel they nice bars and cafe. The staff always welcomed us as we came and went from the hotel, and even when we checked in they upgraded us from a king to two double beds with a view of the Empire State Building. From now on, this is the place I plan to stay at when I go to New York.

Very good spot to start most of the sightseeing, being in walking distance to times square etc.We got a nice little room with a beautiful view on the Empire State Building and the bed was very comftable! You should definately visit the awesome rooftop!

The Moxy was in a great location. The room was very nice with a lovely view. Bar staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Very comfortable mattress and lots of nice touches in the room such as clothes steamer and hair dryer.

Started staying here for business as new home office location is in NoMad and could not be happier with location, staff, and amenities. Staff is a standout all around (friendliness, service, etc), bartender on second floor is an ace, and gym has all the necessities. This is an energetic and vibrant hotel so set your expectations appropriately!

I stayed in 2107 and had a sensational view of the Empire State Building from my room — great at night. The hotel is nestled in the Garden District with easy access to Madison Avenue, Broadway and the Flatiron District.

The hotel is in a great location that is very convenient to get around. Unfortunately, the room was so hot that sleep was impossible. I also struggled with the sink. There was a fold out table and small "stool" but I had to work a bit in the room and that was difficult. I was there for business but the size of the sink wouldn't work for my wife if we were traveling for pleasure.What really sucked was the service after I left. My fault, yes, but I left my prescription sunglasses in the room and called back that same day. I was dumped into the housekeeping manager's VM and he didn't call me back - TWICE. On my third call, after spending a lot of time on hold, I was asked to provide an email address so they could send me the form. This has been frustrating as I know for a fact they were in the room. I would not trust this property or its' management. Not a Marriott experience at all.

Firstly, I picked this location in the Flower District of the Chelsea neighborhood because it was within a 10-minute walk from my event venue in the Flat Iron District. If you like flowers, you'll enjoy walking around the block of the hotel as all the wholesale flower shops line the sidewalks with their colorful sweet smelling living beauties. There are many other hotels on the same block but I'm a Marriott brand loyalty member so I chose to stay at my first Moxy hotel. There is a 1 local train stop on the other side of the block and a R W local stop one block over the other way which was convenient when I wasn't walking or car share riding. I drove into Manhattan with my own car and lucked out finding free street parking not in a hotel loading zone after 7 pm on the block of the hotel which is metered M-F for commercial vehicles only . Despite arriving after 7 o'clock in the evening, my room was not ready. But I chose to accept tokens for a couple free glasses of prosecco and $30 towards food at Bar Feroce on the second floor. When the room was ready, thankfully it was very clean. I stayed in a room with 2 beds on the 22nd floor (no view of the Empire State Building) but pleasantly way from both the rooftop lounge and street noise. There really is not a lot of space in the room. I did assemble the table hanging from one of the hooks on the wall to rest my suitcase and I could still get by it to get to the side of the bed nearest the window. There are bedside nightstands to rest your phone, curtains to block the sun, full length mirror, storage under the beds for shoes, big screen tv, telephone, laptop tray. The bathroom was a comfortable size and it has a sliding door. I found the beds comfortable and slept well. Only 2 of the elevators in the lobby go down to the gym level and parking garage so there were lines for the elevators at busy times. It was also another small annoyance there was no door man at all times because the front doors to the hotel weren't motion-sensor opening. It was a nice perk to have a caffe to grab my morning coffee/tea, a bar (DJ unitl 1 am on Saturdays), a lounge (before 9 pm), a restaurant, and a flower stall all right there in the same building. In addition, the hotel/bar/cafe staff were friendly and provide great service. If you're looking for a trendy new hotel in this area of Manhattan at a reasonable (For NYC standards) price for limited space, check it out.

Beautiful hotel in the heart of the flower district. Amazing rooftop bar with floral decor.Modern, comfortable rooms. Everything new and staff extremely friendly. Thank you Sean Johnson for all your help in making our stay so special!

As soon as you walk through the doors of this hotel, you feel like you've stumbled into an exclusive underground lair. Once you're greeted by the friendly staff and realize that you don't have to "know someone" to get inside, you embrace the cool.The rooms were a cozy size but the details were perfect and every square inch was well-utilized. You won't want to spend much time in the room though, because the 5-star coffee shop and mega-hip rooftop bar are calling your name.It was a pleasure staying here in one of its first months of being open, and I know it's only getting better and better!

Wow, what an experience. From the service when I checked in late at night, to the amenities and the room itself, everything was top notch. The design of the rooms is beautiful and we had an amazing view of the city. The beds were very comfortable, the water pressure in the shower was great, and the rooms were very spacious.I felt like a movie star staying there. It probably didn't hurt that there seemed to be a huge group of fashion models staying there at the same time I was, maybe it was for fashion week. Not surprised this is their go-to spot.The location of the hotel is perfect - it makes the best parts of the city so accessible, whether you are a seasoned NYC veteran or it is your first time in the city. This is a great neighborhood for food, bars, sightseeing, and puts you in a good spot to access the best of the city.I was there for part business, part pleasure, and the hotel was well-suited for both. I am always concerned with NYC hotels that they will be too loud, but my room was very quiet and peaceful.

I really wanted to like this hotel But I couldn’t wait to leave. I have been coming to New York for over 30 years and this was by far the smallest room I ever had. Not only that, but the room smelled terrible which is surprising that since it is only a few months old. It already smells moldy from having the bathroom in the same room and poor ventilation. I had to go out and buy a candle to make the room smell better. On top of that when the air-conditioner kicks in it makes this long humming noise for about three or four minutes. I asked about the noise and the engineer came up and said that there is nothing they can do about it that all the rooms air-conditioners make this noise and that it’s some type of issue that can’t be fixed. I asked for ear plugs and of course I never got those either. Unfortunately there’s no room service either and don’t expect moisturizer because the toiletries are very limited. I’ve requested moisturizer but they don’t have any so I had to go out and buy some as well. I have been traveling for 40 years and have never seen a hotel without toiletries that includes moisturizer. I understand that this brand “” Moxy” Is trying to appeal to millennial’s but It just felt cheap to me. I didn’t appreciate calling the front desk and every time they answer they say “hey . what’s going on” I felt like it I was “hostel chic” themed hotel. The worst part is this hotel is expensive and not worth the price. For the same price I could have stayed at much better hotels. It’s a good thing I was in the hotel alone. I can’t imagine having to share that small space with anybody else. There is no closet so everything is hanging on the wall when you walk in to your room. Awful.

The rooms are cool, the location is great and the cost is very economical (I used points -- which are also at the low end of the spectrum). The rooms are small, but the floor-to-ceiling windows make it feel more spacious than a bigger room with average-sized windows. And you can be in the room and still feel like you are experiencing the city by taking in the amazing view. The small space is really well thought out -- again not making it feel so small. Location is walking distance to so much, with subway and bike share a block away to get to everything else.

The hotel is as good as it looks! Rooms are practic, despite the fact that there is no trash can besides the bathroom one, and beds confortable The rooftop bar has an amazing view of New York skyline.

All I can say is WOW! Spent a few extra bucks to get the city view and it was stunning and well worth the extra money! The staff are super nice and friendly and everything about the hotel feels fresh, new, luxurious and just amazing! I am hard pressed to find anything negative! The hotel café breakfast was very expensive but that's about the only negative I can say! I had a two queen size bedroom shared with my two teenage kids and it was perfect! I guess if you are there to party, which obviously we weren't, it's even more amazing with the DJ's in the bar and the rooftop bar. Thank you Moxy Chelsea for a lovely week and I'm sure we'll meet again! /Richard and the kids.

Although I didn't stay at the Moxy Chelsea, my family took me to its newly opened (March 2019) Feroce Italian restaurant for my birthday. Let me start by saying, WOW -- this place really puts the "special" in "special occasion." For those who appreciate authentic and inventive Italian food, this is the place to go. I wanted the evening to last forever. All of our dishes were amazing from beginning to end, despite each of us ordering very different items. Everything was extremely fresh, masterfully seasoned and cooked, and nicely presented. Our waiter was exceptionally attentive and courteous, and his recommendations were 100% on target. We also got a friendly visit from the manager. The ambiance was lovely, and even at full capacity, the restaurant managed not to be deafening (as many in NYC are). I even encountered a wine on the menu that I hadn't seen anywhere since my trip to Tuscany. Many of the various meal components were imported from Italy and/or were the product of apprenticeships with a prominent Italian culinary family who spent time in New York mentoring the restaurant staff. Additionally, the hotel had a beautiful view of the skyline from its swanky rooftop bar, supposedly one of the highest rooftop bars in Manhattan. A very memorable experience all around! Highly recommended, especially for Italian expats and Italian visitors to New York. My husband and I are considering staying at the hotel for our anniversary.

review_body: The Moxy Chelsea is located super central in the relatively unknown district of Chelsea, more or less directly on Broadway, which runs through the lower parts of Manhattan. Between Midtown with Times Square and some tourist highlights, the Empire State Building or the Flat Iron Building, Noho where the shopping paradise begins, and the hip Meatpacking District.  The rooms are modern, clean, functional and with a Super Manhattan view - even if you don't have a room with a view on the Empire State Building. It goes without saying that the rooms are comparatively small in NYC ;-)Bar and restaurant on the 2nd floor as well as the café on the ground floor are great, super atmospheric and invite you to stay. Unfortunately we didn't manage the super Rooftop-Bar. But it must be a blast. There are yoga classes, a flower shop and the hosted a book release party for Bella Thorne.  Staff is top. When we had difficulties with the elevator on one day (3 out of 4 were cancelled), everyone was really busy and there was generous compensation - which we didn't expect.  Every day there was fresh water and even if there were only clothes hooks with hangers the room was super practical, the beds were really comfortable and the shower had plenty of power - which is not always the case in the USA. We would book it again at any time and recommend it to everyone.  The only drawback: there is no offer for a more environmentally friendly towel change. But this is perhaps the case in the USA.

Moxy Chelsea Team: Paul, Nicole, Jasmine, Danny!- You covered all the bases for any business traveler! Central location, fabulous caffè and co-working space, great Italian restaurant, trendy rooftop cocktail bar, cozy rooms with floor to ceiling widows offering panoramic views of NYC and superb service! During my stay I needed to strategize and conservatory is a calm yet social space with vibriant yellow chairs and green plants that helped my creativity. I had marvelous stay. Looking forward to revisit, dine, work, strategize and play!

Visiting my daughter at college, Moxy NYC Chelsea is in a fantastic location walking distance to Penn Station, Flat Iron district and 12 minute subway ride to Parsons/NYU via 28 St. Broadway. Best thing is walking out of the hotel and in the middle of flowers and greenery in the urban landscape since it's in the Flower District.As far as the hotel is concerned, Danny at the front desk was very helpful and nice making checkin and checkout process pleasant. The second floor bar are is great to meet for drinks or hanging out with friends. Rooms are expectedly small but new and clean and the view of The Empire State building is fantastic. Slight inconvenience due to the grand opening which closed off the roof deck bar and had a different line entrance for hotel guests.Few niggles, the shower door, which is a double sliding door to the toilet, leaks onto the floor and I for-see issues in the near future. Gap in the room door allowed sound to travel from the halls which also opens right into the side of the sink making it awkward to roll in with bags. Mind you there is no closet space but hooks along the side of the room sufficed for a single traveler. The only desk/workspace is a foldable chair and table that are hung on the fore-mentioned hooks. If you need to do any type of work, you may need to go to the bar area. The bag check, unfortunately is in the basement and the only way to get down a floor is the elevators which seemed to take awhile to get down and back up again.

We stayed at the Moxy NYC Chelsea for 7 nights, our first time visiting New York.Check in was simple and efficient - staff reasonably helpful and we were given a fantastic room high up on the 25th floor with views of the Empire State Building. Great start to the trip!The room was very small but we knew this before based on the website and reviews in Tripadvisor. Very clean and tidy on arrival and a welcome retreat after a long journey. The soundproofing was adequate considering the bustle of the city below us.Housekeeping throughout the week was sporadic at best. Beds made, but bed linen not changed frequently and even the water glasses (plastic jars) weren’t replaced with fresh ones in a daily basis.The rooftop bar has amazing views of the city, but it’s enclosed and the drinks menu limited. Seems to be a place to be seen more than anything else - style over substance. The bar on the 2nd floor was excellent - great service and good selection of drinks and bites to eat - we really liked this space.The adjacent coffee shop - Ferocce is worth going to. Great, but pricey coffee and lovely breakfast items and pastries. The boys on the coffee bar were cracking and their chat excellent.Staying here for a week allowed us to see the good and bad of the hotel. Staff were a hit or a miss - quality of service dependant in who you spoke to (Claudia was the standout and most helpful and customer focussed out of them all - she just gets it). The elevators were very frustrating especially at the weekends where non-residents are going to the rooftop bar - very long waits and poorly managed. The hotel staff seemed to want to cater more for the bar customers needs and wants as opposed to paying hotel guests...The hotels opening party was on the during our last night at the hotel. We weren’t informed of this on booking nor at check in. We had a letter slid under the door the morning of the party to advise us of potential disruption. Needless to say, the staff were more focussed on the party than the guests. Getting entry to the hotel was cumbersome and took ages - got to look after the b list celebrities it would appear!!Overall, it’s a shiny new hotel with lots of plus points. The rooms, although new, have a few design flaws - shower leaks into floor of room and adjacent toilet for example. Bed too close to the wall and limited space to walk past it. The WiFi is solid and very fast, so this was another plus point.The location is amazing though with easy access to the subway and so many of NYC’s main attractions are within walking distance. 5 mins and you are at Maddison Square Gardens for the basketball for example.Marketed and designed clearly for Millenials - it’s worth a stay but I’d only come back if my trip was for up to 3 nights maximum.

I had a meeting in NYC and booked at Moxy Chelsea. My expectations were average knowing it is a city, part of Marriott distinctive select hotels.Checked in on my way to NYC. By the time I arrived I got the electronic keys on my phone.The location is prime close to Penn Station. On the same street there are multiple hotels making it a relatively busy location.The entrance is nicely done, staff cheerful and helpful. Room was on higher floor, accessible by mobile, not large room (convenient for short stays), the design is modern and funky.I would stay there again for sure.

We had an amazing stay! The staff was very friendly upon arrival, check-in quick and easy. Our room on the 19th floor had the most amazing view of the Empire State Building. The room itself is small but had everything you need, very clean and an overall cool New York interieur style.The top floor of the hotel houses a spacious rooftop bar, great views all around! All this in the flower district, fresh flowers in the streets when you walk in and out. Thank you Moxy, we had a great week in New York, hope to stay with you again soon!

This was my first stay at the Moxie brand, I expected it to be dark, cool, and catering towards a crowd with less gray hear than me and indeed it was. I can live with that but there are some significant detractors from the stay quality. The room is tiny, there is a pop out table and compact chair that is best suited for a dorm room. They have these folded and on the wall so you may not even notice it. Theres barely any place to put them and its not comfortable. So if you intend to do some work while staying there its a challenge. The sink is also in the bed room which further cramps things. The hvac system was off during my stay- meaning it was putting warm humid air in while I wanted the AC on. No bath towels were in the room when I checked in. Last, a serious issue for hotel with 35 stories is the lack of working elevators, there were just two available the night I checked in. One was giving access to the night club rather than guests so that was unavailable. Another elevator was on and off use and staff use them as well so be prepared to wait a while. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I didnt make much use of the common area on the second floor. Gym was decent but too warm, it is a challenge to get to the gym because there was only one working elevator that went to the basement during much of my stay.I wish I liked the hotel more, it be fine to just sleep in but given the rates (and yes IM aware this is Manhattan) I expected more value and the ability to comfortably get some work done in my room. Also not much value for Marriott elites, no upgrade and a token which is good for 10 dollars at the bar- that doesnt get you much at the prices they charge there.

review_body: attention, this is not a classic hotel but a nigthclub and 2 restaurantsas it is open for all public hotelguests are a minority and thus neglectedrestaurants and nigthclub are always crowded elevators are occupiedservice by inexperient staff mostly very young people

We had a great week-long stay at Moxy NYC Chelsea. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff; they went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay and everyone we met was so friendly. The rooms are fantastic, the views great and the rooftop bar is amazing!

Stayed at this gem of a hotel in the middle of the flower district, for my birthday. True to the area, once you enter the lobby there is a little flower shop and the lobby smells beautiful. The views are spectacular with uber friendly staff; ask for the highest floor possible.

The Moxy Chelsea is ideal. A block in either direction are two different subways making it extremely convenient, but it’s in Chelsea, so no need to go too far! The rooms and communal spaces are fantastic...with a European vibe that is fun, modern and totally comfortable at the same time. We loved the 2nd floor bar and sofa areas. A great place for drinks, an espresso and the paper, or even a bocce game. The rooms are decorated with a chic flair and are lined with windows and great views, plus, as others have said, the beds and pillows are really comfortable.

review_body: This was our first time visiting NYC and the welcome we got from the staff was amazing. Danny was our go to guy. He hooked us up with where to go and what to see in limited time in the city. He was a wealth of information and made us feel so comfortable. The second we walked into the hotel we were embraced with the amazing floral scent and cheery staff. The cafe was fabulous. Must have the mini donuts! Kid friendly and so fun. Great location. We will stay there again when we'rein NYC.

We stayed here and loved it! The design of the spaces are absolutely beautiful! The staff is wonderful too! Kinesha and Lisa were so fun and accommodating. This property has the perfect mix of modern with a bit of vintage charm. The location was convenient and allowed us to access all of our favorite shopping places we wanted to get to. I can't wait to stay here again!

Just spent a night at the Moxy NYC Chelsea. The staff was lovely, the rooms clean and the area was perfect. Both the bar on the 2nd floor and the roof top bar were great! Those staying, be sure to get to the roof top bar for the specialty drinks and the view - both were amazing! The only issue was the the hotel was so busy, the elevators were a bit slow.

This hotel is a gem! Incredibly clean and quiet rooms. So trendy and the staff are amazing! We frequent NYC and will definitely be making this our choice for future NYC trips! Be sure to check out the rooftop for the amazing view!

This hotel has everything we need for a very reasonable price ... On each floor I was surprised, I discovered a different place, between the flower shop at the entrance and the flower room on the rooftop! Such a beautiful place to stay in NY ! A bit in the spirit of a soho house... but for everyone ! ;)

We had a great stay at the Moxy Chelsea. The room was beautiful and clean and with a great view of the city. The hotel has a perfect location in the heart of Chelsea, close to restaurants, shopping and nightlife. The service was outstanding and so was the restaurant and cafe at the hotel. I really recommend this hotel.

From the time I arrived Tiffany (the Moxy staff member that checked me in) provided excellent service. Her vibrant and cheerful personality instantly brightening what started off as a frustrating journey into the city. I also loved the super cute lobby entrance. The lobby fragrance might have been the best part, loved whatever aromas they were using. The rooms themselves are cozy. I really enjoyed the skyline view from my window. I'm a bit of a neat-freak and hotels don't typically meet my satisfaction when it comes to cleanliness but I was comfortable at Moxy. Overall, it was a wonderful experience and I would certainly stay again. There was a cool little social area on the second floor that I didn't get to experience, so I hope to hang out there a bit on my next stay.

It would be remiss of me if I didn’t do this review. I come to New York 1-2 times a month for work, for about a week at a time. While being away from home, there’s nothing more that I want than to feel at home - and Moxy Chelsea did it for me. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a smile and welcome from Danny that made me feelapart of the Moxy/Bonvoy family. Danny was in the details as he learned my birthday was a couple days prior to my checkin. For that, thank you Danny. You won’t ever know what that meant for me. Their team is unmatched. People like Danny and Karnesha just to name a few are the reason that I’ve changed all future NYC travel plans (fun or business) in the near future, to make sure I stay at Moxy Chelsea. see y’all in a couple weeks!

I stayed here for a weekend getaway and I loved my room. It had all the essentials, and a rain shower that I fell in love with! The front desk was very friendly and personalized both my check in and check out experience. The view from my room was amazing! I was right next to the empire state building. The lounge was very nice and the restaurant staff were very attentive . over all a wonderful stay and I would definitely stay here again!

Check in and check out was smooth and easy. This was my first time at the Moxy in Chelsea but not my first time at a Moxy, and I will stay at this brand again. The rooms are small - but that is what the concept is - and perfect for what I needed for my business trip. Danny at the front desk was a delight and extremely helpful. I will come back the next time I am visiting NY. They offer coffee in the mornings through the cafe next to the lobby, which is a nice touch that you can grab a coffee for free and then purchase a pastry to go with it if you like. Sometimes at hotels you feel like you have to take the free coffee back to your room, so I liked that you could sit and enjoy it in a cafe. Service at the restaurant/bar was great and the free drink upon check in is a nice touch.

I stayed here for a long weekend getaway and my room was quiet, super comfy, and had stellar views! The Front Desk staff has great personality and so does the rooftop bar team. Speaking of, the enclosed rooftop bar has absolutely spectacular views that literally had me #shook! You must go just to check out the bar upstairs, plus the wine selection is nice too. This is a great choice hotel and in a prime location. Keep it up MOXY!

I highly recommend staying at Moxy Chelsea, the hotel is out of this world. The views are incredible and the staff and friendly and VERY accommodating. The hotel has a lively vibe but is peaceful and quiet at the same time, the roof top bar is definitely worth a vist - we didn't want to leave and will definitely be back.

Amazing views from my guest room and especially the rooftop bar areas. The staff at the front desk were incredibly friendly, especially when accommodating a room switch due to a issue in my original room (Engineer was kind as well!) With the hotel's Chelsea location, unique room décor, cleanliness, and friendly staff, I would definitely return and recommend! Thank You!

very well appointed public spaces; well designed guest room which didn't feel as small as it was. The ceiling height added to sense of space in the guest room. The lobby bar on the 2nd floor had a great environment set up for both working and socializing.

When you walk in through the flower shop, you are being transported from the hustle and bustle of the city into a secret garden. Take a deep breath and smell the fragrance of the multitude of flowers that great you and your transformation is complete. I stayed here in March and was instantly impressed with the design details of the Hotel Moxy Chelsea. This place is stunning. Flowers are all around you, rich details of velvet in burgandy hues. Feroce cafe at ground level has amazing coffee and pastries before you hit the streets in the morning and bar Feroce on the second floor is a great place to sit and have a drink or two with friends after a long day of walking around the city. For an evening out, take a trip up to the Fleur Room and prepare to have your breath taken away. The rooftops unobstructed views of the city are enough to keep you from venturing out any further. The rooms themselves are a study in a well thought out use of space without sacrificing any attention to detail or design. I stayed in a corner south facing room and had a view of the southern tip of Manhattan and I could even see the Statue of Liberty. I lived in the city for many years and this will be my new go to home base for my trips back for a visit.

The moxy is awesome. Great bar on level two. We sat and did work and then rolled right to cocktails. Breakfast is so good. Gym was perfect and empty - maybe everyone was partying late at the rooftop bar. Will stay here again!!

Booked this hotel for 7 nights. It was small but clean and location seems to be good. However, I’m a bit disappointed as I have high expectations. It seems to lack compassion. One of the guests had an accident, has to cut the holiday short, like half of the nights, as they needed to fly back home for in order to go through a surgery because of the accident. We have asked if we can recover the costs of the unstayed nights because of the unfortunate incident that no one ever wanted to happened. I understand that you have policies and cancellation procedures and it’s not your fault that the accident happened. However accidents happens and it’s beyond the control of everyone. But perhaps rather than sticking to your policy, in unfortunate events like this where you can gather evidence and see that the situation they claim is indeed genuine and not just to rip you off and not requesting because they just don’t like it there, you can perhaps make a consideration on exceptional circumstances. I’m also not saying that you agree to every request of the guest, but severity needs to be considered. Especially if it’s in the matter of life. We just did not request because we want to, but because it is a necessity. And if we stayed longer to get the value of our money because your policy does not allow refunds, the guest could be paralysed.We travel and understand hotel policies. But maybe there would be a hotel that would understand that life > money.If this happened to you, I’m sure you would not feel any different.

New hotel! Great service, cool room decor, great location in the wholesale flower district. The wood grilled pizza at the second floor bar was fantastic. Lovely staff, very friendly and accommodating. Recommend.

beautiful hotel design in a nice nyc neighborhood, hotel stuff were awesome and helpful,cozy, light filled, functional, and nicely sized bedrooms, really nice hotel a and panoramic rooftop views was super cool and beautiful

We had a great night away from our kids. The staff was amazing and so nice. It was great place to hang back and grab a drinks with friends up at the top floor bar. Great View of Empire State building at indoor bars. Great selfie location.We loved beautiful hotel design, friendly staff, cozy, light filled, functional, and nicely sized bedrooms, amazing rain shower, comfortable spacious lobby, sunlit conservatory, and panoramic rooftop views. Be sure to try the bed time story feature on the phone.

Looking forward to be back soon! The hotel is so different as any others I've been before. Very cool and cozy hotel and the rooms are super functional. I love the shower of the room, it is the best shower ever!The location of the hotel is perfect and the area around is great!Don't forget to go to the rooftop! You can see the whole New York views as well as the Empire State building just in front of you! It is the best hotel I've ever been! The staff was very helpful and nice too! 100% recommended hotel!

I had an amazing experience staying at Moxy NYC Chelsea. This hotel is in the perfect location. Right off the bat, the drive in from the airport (Newark) was incredibly easy and direct. Everyone at the hotel was super friendly upon my arrival, welcoming me with complimentary drink coins (super cute!). Hardly ever do I get to stay in a brand new hotel. The rooms were modern and unique --- giving the hotel it's signature style of urban chic. I had friends join me for drinks and pizza at Bar Feroce. The pizza was delicious. We went upstairs to the Fleur Room with breathtaking views of the city. The bed was very comfortable and the rain shower is a must! I had come to NY to see my best friend who just had a baby and had the EASIEST time getting to and from Brooklyn. Literally 20 minutes which made my trip that much better. I was able to walk to the Chelsea Market and Times Square to see a play in under 25 minutes. But I cannot stress enough how great the subway stop is right outside the hotel. It connects to everything. The last night I had dinner at Feroce. The service was exceptional and the food was out of this world. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and can't imagine why I wouldn't stay here every time!

Has a fantastic stay at the Moxy Chelsea. Smaller hotel nestled in the flower district, convenient to subway, Penn Station, Port Authority, Path. Great location as vase to explore NYC. The hotel is very stylish without being overly hip. The rooms are very well design, though also very small. If a big room is your thing then this is not the hotel for you, but who needs loads of space when all of Manhattan is at your doorstep? The service was friendly and not overly formal or fussy, which we loved! Thanks Moxy!

Had a great stay during the opening week of the hotel, staff are extremely friendly and help, they were super accommodating with my dog and he felt like a star every time we walked through the lobby for our walks (they remembered his name every time). Also they brought up a soft fleece blanket, bowls and even some treats. cozy rooms with everything we needed and a fun design overall. Great panoramic views from the rooftop bar.

Great location, walking distance to many nice spots. Super clean and new. The shower was amazing and I want to buy the shampoo they had. Will definately come back. The fire alarm went off in the mornirng (it wasnt their fault), that's the only thing that didnt go perfect. The entrance has a flower shop and a bakery, so it was an incredible experience to come in the hotel after walking around the NYV jungle.

The Moxy is just a fun and easy experience all around. To start things off, not only are you in the flower district, so the streetscape is beautiful and interesting, but you enter the hotel through an enchanting little flower shop. The staff are laid back, but very helpful. The views from the rooms are great as there are floor to ceiling windows along the entire wall. The room layout is super efficient, in a good way, and the decor/vibe really adds to the enjoyable experience. You feel like you are somewhere special, not just another boring hotel room.

Was privileged to be able to participate in Moxy Chelsea’s opening weekend. Me and the wife decided to bring the family for a little staycation and visit with family in the city. We stayed in 2 connected rooms as we are a family of 5. The room design is superb. Everything seems to have its place and the finish has a very modern refined feel.Made our way up to the club level on the 35th floor and was amazed by the city views. Truely spectacular. We did have some issues with our room keys not operating correctly at first, however our issues were addressed quickly by staff which I must say was impressive considering it was their first weekend. You could tell the staff was excited about the opening and the vibe translated down to the service received. Overall great stay.

I am truly impressed with Moxy NYC. All the staffs are youthful and very helpful. Special shout out to Sheana who moved me to a quiet room promptly. The room was small but functional. The bars on second floor and top floor are super fun and reasonably priced. For a Marriott property, Moxy is very cost efficient. I would stay here again.

Bonvoy Platinum member and this was first time staying at a Moxy. I liked the vibe of the hotel. They carried the local florist nature of the street throughout the hotel common areas from the entrance to the rooftop. Staff was great—very friendly, fun, and engaging (both desk and bartender). Public areas designed well with good vibe. BUT seemed to lack outlets in the areas you would want them when hanging out working on your laptop in the 2nd floor lounge.Room. Well designed room. Didn’t mind that there was no closet with just open hooks and hangers. Would be nice to have a drawer or two available...a bit weird hanging my underwear, socks, and T-shirt’s on hooks instead of throwing in a drawer. Shower doors look good but don’t work well...water leaked out into toilet room floor and room floor whenever used (even briefly). They need to stock room with more than one towel, as mine had to serve dual purpose to dry myself then dry the floor. Bedding. This was the worst part. I’ve stayed at nearly all Starwood and Marriott types of hotels, and the bed was the most uncomforable. Mattress was a bit hard and lumpy and sheets were scratchy but nothing unbearable. But the pillows were some sort of poly fill that doesn’t compress at all when you put your head on it. I had to put head against the hard lumpy mattress instead and the pillow was so uncomforable. I almost called the front desk after an hour of trying to sleep to see if they have softer or down pillows available (which they may have). I was glad I wasn’t staying for more than one night. But the staff, cleanliness, and design and decor made up for the shortcomings enough to give it a three star rating.

A friend of mine stayed at Moxy Chelsea when it opened in February and suggested that my wife and I check it out for a Saturday night staycation. I’m happy he told us to go – it’s one of the most beautifully constructed, designed hotels we’ve ever seen. It was clearly built with impeccable quality and obvious passion and dedication! We’ll be back!

review_body: My wife, kids and I stayed at the new Moxy Chelsea and it exceeded all of our expectations. My family loved the functional bunkbed room and Feroce was delicious for both breakfast and dinner. Everyone on the staff was so friendly to us and the hotel’s location is convenient to wherever you’re looking to go in NYC

I visited the moxy times sq before and wanted to try a new moxy hotel in NYC. I reserved the bunked bed because my kids had a blast last time. This time, the occasion was for my daughter's bday. When I checked in, the person asked me what was the occasion, when i told him (sorry, i forgot the gentleman's name) it was for my daughter's bday, he went out of his way and prepared our room (while we waited at the bar) with candles, flower petals and even wrote a HB msg on the room mirror. My daughter was thrilled and pleasantly surprised. What a great gesture!The hotel is fairly new and in a great location. Given it is a boutique hotel, the room is relatively small but smartly designed with enough storage space, hangers, and a folding table/chair. One minor note was that the shower was not as strong compared to the moxy in times sq but everything else was near perfection.

I had an amazing time here with my husband when we stayed for one night in February. As new parents, we wanted a night out just to be together. The staff is absolutely amazing and are always willing to help. When we got to our room, we had views of the Hudson River but I called to see if we could get a city view room instead. Christian was wonderful in finding me a new room and when I asked if we could stay in the river view room just to watch the sunset, they didn't mind at all! I needed to pump and store my milk and Nicole at the front desk was right on it, without me having to get into anymore detail. We went out to dinner and when we got back, there was a mini-fridge in our room. The rooftop bar/lounge/club is beautifully decorated with absolutely spectacular views of NYC! The restaurant was not open yet as we were there during the grand opening weeks but I can't wait to come back and try it out the next time we're there. Moxy, baby, I'm a huge fan!

New hotel in Chelsea area, just a few short blocks to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Terrific staff, especially Keneisha and Claudia at the front desk! Good and spacious bar on the second floor in addition to the roof top. Was great for business travel. good to have the cafe connected to the lobby. Snug rooms but efficient and terrific shower!

review_body: My husband and I along with another couple stayed at this property for an overnight after meeting other friends in the city for dinner. The Moxy was the perfect place to stay. Within walking distance to restaurants and bars. Rooms were the perfect size and super clean. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

We were so pleasantly surprised for we truly elated with all the Moxy had to offer . Tucked in surrounded by flower distract blooms & fauna abound . It’s beaming windows & flower wall bar oasis was just what we needed when we arrived . For my 16 year daughter she approved for the spaces were well thought out innovative pretty design . This is a place we were so happy we booked !

The hotel itself is great. The bar on the second floor Is highly recommended. The rooftop bar had spectacular views but the staff was average. This is a new place so they need to get the hang of it. Kanesha was super!! Seemed silly that only 1 free coffee (with 2 traveling together) was offered to gold members. I do miss SPG.

Great view. Easy check in. Room is small but fine. Quiet enough. Clean and new. Staff was great. Location was convenient. Location was great. Price was reasonable. Elevators were a bit confusing but not a problem.

This hotel is located in midtown Manhattan and that is absolutely one of the best places to stay when you are visiting NYC for a few days. There are a lot of nice restaurants nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner (Panera Bread, Brooklyn Bagel & Coffee Company, Johny’s Luncheonette, Chipotle, Outback and many more). Koreatown (which is an absolute must) is a few streets away.We arrived late in the evening and were given a room on the 7th floor. The following morning I asked for a room with a view of the Empire State building and while we were out sightseeing the hotel moved our luggage and when we came back we got a room on the 20th floor with an amazing view of the ESB! Thank you so much!! The room was of a good size for NY standards, nice comfy bed, very clean and a wonderful rain shower. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The views from the rooftop bar on the 35th floor are amazing, especially at sunset!Would absolutely recommend this hotel!

It’s such a great new addition to Chelsea. I chekecked out different room types. Even though the rooms are small, they all are very cozy. What makes this hotels stand out is the welcoming staff. I had a few encounters with Danny. He’s always sincerely trying to help. Awesomeness!

The Moxy is brand new and looks awesome! I loved the shower, the views, and the great staff. Be sure to grab a drink at the roof top bar with some of the best views in NYC. The rooms are cozy but very function and you have everything you need. I loved being able to stream Netflix on the huge TV. The location is great too!

Positive:1. Comfortable bed 2. Good view3. 2nd floor bar has a good vibe and well decorated4. People were generally niceNegatives:1. Denied access to the roof top bar after 930 because it’s for their VIP guest list then. As a “titanium” (old platinum) Marriott member that is beyond ridiculous. 2. Literally zero benefit for Marriott status3. Small room, but that’s ok for NYC4. But small means no real desk, no closet (only 3 hangers to hang shirts next to TV).....5. Gym is okay. Good for cardio, not much else.Ultimately if you are a business traveler with Marriott status that needs to work and would like to have a legit gym.... look elsewhere. You can find much much better at a similar price.

This new hotel has everything you could ask for from the Amazing team down to the cleanliness of the hotel. The things I loved was the super fast internet as well as being able to connect my Netflix account to the enormous in room TV! I look forward to my next trip and enjoying the rooftop lounge.

review_body: I loved the style and ambiance of Moxy Chelsea, especially with the little flower shop in the front. The staff were totally amazing all around, both in the front and at the various bars. The rooms were small, but likely average for NYC standards, but I thought really well laid out for the space and really liked the style/decor.The 2nd floor bar was amongst my favorite and would come back to hit the rooftop another time too. My only knock as suggested by the title was that one morning I literally had a freezing cold shower. That might turn some people off, but it was fixed for the next day and I was likely a little more invigorated than I would have otherwise been. It essentially knocks my rating down to a 4.5 or so, but I will give them the benefit of the doubt since the rest of my crew had nice hot showers... too bad for me I guess.I'd stay again.

This brand new hotel is in midtown Manhattan, in the Chelsea area which is a great location for shopping and sightseeing. I greatly appreciate the beautiful hotel design and the personable and friendly welcome from the staff.Rooms are nice, cozy and functional.This place is worth the experience while vacationing in New York.

I had the most incredible time with my friends at Moxy Chelsea. It's so adorable from right when you walk in, the flower shop is beautiful and there are such cute flowery places up and down the whole street. The people who checked us in were super attentive to our needs and gave us a room upgrade no problem when dealing with a special circumstance. Our room was CUTE- super Instagram worthy- and the beds gave us a great sleep. I think our favorite part, however, was the lounge on the second floor- HUGE windows, cute velvet furniture, one of the best naturally lit rooms I've ever seen. Overall, there are so many thoughtful details that make Moxy the only place to stay. When I'm back I will most definitely spend my time here!!

I was extremely impressed with the hotel, great location fantastic facilities, rooms are big for NYC, but on my second night there I was trying to sleep and was kept awake by a loud base going through my room constantly from midnight until 3:30 in the morning. It was brutal. I called down and they could not identify the source of the noise. Don't know what was going on but I was disappointed after a great stay.

We stayed there a few days before their grand opening, the hotel was still finishing up some of the rooms and restaurants. The hotel is new and clean, well thought out and designed and with very comfortable beds. The views are incredible, as the windows are from floor to ceiling and the AC easy to use. The showers are incredible, big and with lots of water pressure. Their staff is incredibly friendly, especially Eva from Human Resources. We met her at the breakfast lounge and she was outstanding. She took great care of us throughout our stay. Also, Paul, even though we didn’t meet, kept in touch with us by email before and during our trip. They have a great staff that cares for you, truly cares for you, which made our trip to NYC even better. The only downside is that there is no closet space, many hangers along the wall, but no closet, but it wasn’t a big deal for us. The location is great as well. Close to midtown and to the metro. And hardly any noise, which in a big city like NY is always welcome. Unfortunately, we had to leave the hotel and move to the Moxy Times Square due to their grand opening event, but they moved everything for us, took great care of us and made us feel at home in the other hotel. We hope to return again to the Moxy Chelsea very soon.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Moxy Chelsea for a weekend staycation and it was great! We were really impressed by the friendly staff and LOVED the views from our room on the 29th floor. The floor-to-ceilings windows made waking up to the sunrise feel like a dream.

review_body: Stayed at this new Hotel “Moxy” Chelsea in NYC. I didn’t know much about this new Brand. But, what a cool place to stay. I had a fantastic time. Every staff member I encountered was welcoming, friendly, funny, and professional. The room was clean and with a beautiful view of the NYC Skylight. Amazing rain shower OMG!!! Same with the rooftop bar… Panoramic rooftop views. WOW!! Moxy Chelsea see you soon…. I’m coming back and back - And back.

When you enter the building you are welcomed in by a lovey garden mixed with some the most beautiful flowers you’ve ever seen. Followed by that, you a greated by a cheerful friendly staff that was quick and efficient on the check in (always a plus). We walked into our room and was delighted by how functional the space was. The views were simply amazing (Empire State) with the floor to celing windows. They have the type of beds that you want to cozy up and watch movies for your entire stay, that’s how comfortable it was. Make sure you vist the roof top bar as well it has like a 360 view of the city. Simply put this place was AMAZING!!!! And I will be back again.

So the positives about the Moxy is that the staff was friendly and the bathroom had a nice rain shower head. The negatives are that the rooms are much smaller than comparable “boutique” hotels - hanging furniture I looks cool in a photo - not so much when you realize the room’s too small to use it. Bathroom is right next to bed with frosted glass panels and door. Basically you can see and hear everything anyone does in there. Bathroom sink is so short and shallow that water splashes all over the room. And when we checked in we were given wooden coins “to get your evening started with a drink on us”. When we presented it at the bar they said, That’s only for Prosecco”. Nice bait and switch.

The hotel is on 27th Avenue and is quite unusual in that it has a florist in the lobby. Check in was quick and friendly and the rooms are modern but small. The chair and table fold and hang from the wall to save space. The shower is large and good quality The bar service was good with lots of staff in the lounge/bar and drinks were okay but has a limited beer selection. Breakfast is included in the price and of decent quality with good cakes/pastries ,coffee and cooked breakfast. Overall a good hotel with e celebrate service. Couldn’t try the roof top bar as closed for private functions both nights we were there

My friend and I stayed at the Moxy Chelsea for a two night staycation. The location was amazing! It's right next to the flower district and walking distance to everything you could want. I loved how the Italian/Floral theme played throughout the hotel. They didn't miss any detail. The beds are comfortable, the shower was wonderful and the view of the city was unbelievable. I'd recommend The Moxy Chelsea to pretty much anybody staying in Manhattan.

I absolutely loved my stay at Moxy Chelsea! I was the 30th floor facing the Empire State Building and the view from my large floor-to-ceiling windows was FANTASTIC. The room was much larger than I expected, with plenty of room for two people. I loved how efficient the space was, the rain shower was super nice, and the little details from the sink to the phone were all so unique. The hotel is so perfectly located in a chill enough neighborhood (the beautiful flower district) while still being within walking distance to everything from museums to parks to Broadway shows. Lots of food options nearby as well, including the caffè and restaurant downstairs, and the rooftop bar is so gorgeous and ornate with some of the best views in the city. Totally recommend this place to anyone!

review_body: The views from my room were unbelievable! When I walked into the room, I was surprised with floor to ceiling windows that overlooked midtown Manhattan and one of the nicest streets in Chelsea, The room size is was what I expected in NYC except this hotel room offers a unique hook system along the wall to easily hang my clothes and steam them in the morning with the steamer provided in the room. An unusually large bathroom ("some regrets" inscribed in the tile - LOL!) . The staff as cool as the room!

Love the Moxy! Reception staff were efficient and helpful. My room on the 29th floor had great views, a comfortable bed, and fun design features. Appreciated the clothes steamer! Great gym with plenty of options including a heavy bag and boxing gloves. The second floor bar is lovely in the afternoon and we received complimentary bubbly. The buffet breakfast was deluxe with several healthy options (including gluten free bread). Will certainly be back on my next NYC business trip.
