review_body: +Good location, nice rooms, very tidy all around.-Rooftop bar not once available during out stay, nice false advertising by Marriott Hotels. Each day the staff promised that the bar would be available for the residents of the hotel, but by the time it was supposed to open there had been a sudden change of plans which would make it unaccessible. They also tried kicking us out of the hotel in the middle of our stay, because the owners wanted to ”suddenly” host a 1200 person party. No attempt by the staff to try to make up for this. The shower closet leaks so that the toilet area and the room itself is covered in water. My worst experience at a Marriott Hotel so far. Vacation pretty much ruined in this wonderful city because of all these mishaps at MOXY Hotel. Take better care of your customers, owners should understand this!

I am going to preface this review by telling you that I have not stayed at this property. Couldn't tell you anything about the place other than the address. So why one star? Seems pretty harsh, huh?I am a Marriott Bonvoy Platinum member, which means, I spend way too much time in their properties and generally, I have a very positive opinion of the brand. I also have a a lot of points, so when my wife, teenage daughter, and some family friends were planning an overnight in NYC to see a concert, I was more than happy to cash in points for two rooms. At least on the website, the Moxy looked like a cool new property near the Hammerstein Ballroom, so I reserved rooms for Thursday night. Everyone was really excited for the trip, that is, until they arrived.My wife and crew arrived and were informed that there weren't any rooms available for them, and the hotel wasn't exactly fully open. How about that one? Was this a surprise to management that people were going to show for a reservation? I don't work in this industry, but seems like pretty easy math. Could they have not worked this out in advance, rebooked them into another Marriott property prior to arrival? So they booked them in to the Moxy Times Square, and transferred points back in to my account, which was nice, but did they think to arrange transportation for 3 moms and their daughters? Did I mention, we aren't from NYC and they don't know their way around the city? The answer is "Nope", they just gave them the address and sent them on their merry way.I would like to say this story got better, but it didn't. Tomorrow I will post a review of Moxy Times Square. Awful preparation and awful customer service.

We had a great 5 night stay at the very new Moxy Chelsea. We were a bit concerned initially as the hotel hadn’t opened when we booked our trip and we then found out that although the hotel had launched the restaurants wouldn’t be open until after we arrived. We were a bit worried we would be arriving to a building site, however others reviews reassured us. When we arrived at the hotel the staff member that checked us in advised that as the restaurants weren’t open we’d be receiving a complimentary breakfast each day! The staff were kind, helpful and full of energy. The hotel itself was spotless and ideally located in Chelsea. Our room was clean and bright and the floor to ceiling windows really helped to make the room feel bigger. I had emailed to request a room with a good view if possible as we were in NY celebrating a birthday and were shocked when we got there to find out we’d been given a room with a view of the Empire State Building. It was stunning!Overall we had a great experience at this hotel and in the city. Wish I could do it again!

Spent the night at this new property and had a wonderful experience! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Amazing rain shower, and guest rooms had high ceilings with awesome views! Will definitely be back!

review_body: I cannot say enough about this cozy boutique hotel. It's sleek, charming, comfortable and cool without being pretentious. The location is good and the accommodations are attractive and really smart. I loved every little well thought out detail. The price is right, the rooms are awesome and the staff is amazing. I'm a major hotel snob and I loved this unique space!

We were there before the official opening. Great location in the flower district. Staff were friendly and very energetic. The rooms are a little smaller but very well done in an industrial look. Clean and more than functional I prefer these smaller rooms with no carpet than the bigger ones. Fantastic looking 2nd floor bar and a rooftop bar I think was the 35th floor with amazing views. Moxy hotel beat our expectations and delivered on all fronts. Will definitely recommend.

room: room was good, it served its purpose. Bed was comfortable. the wifi was hard to connect to and the shower door jammed a bit but these were minor. Overall, great experiencelocation: extremely convenient location, central to everything (28th & 6th).amenities: breakfast was delicious. gym was extremely new and had all the equipment i needed (treadmill, pullup bar, dumbells, exercise balls)staff: The staff was amazing! super friendly and eager to help. Kanisha and Linda were both super nice and friendly and happy to provide recommendations.OVerall experience was great, so much so that i had already booked this place again for another trip

My husband and I stayed at the newly opened Moxy Chelsea for a staycation. From the beautiful flower shop entry to the unique floral furniture and disco ball on the rooftop - this hotel is unlike any other in the city! Our room was exceptionally comfortable and the views were epic = perfect for a weekend trip. Most importantly, the hotel crew was very professional and helpful.We met the GM, Paul, in the lobby, he surely knows what he's doing! Thank you for such a great stay Moxy Chelsea - we'll be back soon.

We stayed here for business. We had a great experience and loved everything about it. Internet was fast and cell reception was strong... Great breakfast in the Rooftop Bar and nice views of the city...

Stayed during the second week of open. Room was small but functional. Great Gym, which was a little hot but had great equipment. The Common space at the 2nd floor bar and at the roof top are amazing with great service and excellent flare. The drinks were were excellent and so was the roof top breakfast. Great location with the 1 and W a block away and Penn a few blocks away. The block they are on leaves a little to be desired but the area is changing over. Recommend staying on higher floors to stay away from the street noise and adjacent construction noise. Would stay there again!

A new addition to the neighborhood brings tremendous charm with the staff, rooms and rooftop lounge. The rooms are compact but very comfortable. The shower is absolutely fantastic. The rooms offer great views of the city. The staff is outstanding. The breakfast served each morning in the rooftop lounge was fantastic. The evening happy hour was great as well I highly recommend this new Marriott hotel

I don’t review frequently, but as this is a new hotel and as I had such a great experience staying here, I thought it would be worthwhile to review. I am currently staying at the new Moxy Chelsea and it’s been one of my best Marriott stays I have ever had in NYC. The staff have been excellent- accommodating, friendly, and address me by my first name every time I leave the main floor. The views from the top, glassed-in breakfast area cannot be beat and the breakfast was excellent. My room is trendy, contemporary and has everthirtng I need. For some reason I just love the wall pegs for all my stuff. This hotel is very forward-thinking- it’s got everything you’d need without the clutter. It’s gorgeous too: fresh, colorful and cozy. I will be staying here many more times.

review_body: Great new boutique hotel with a really pleasant buzz about it . Small reception but very accommodating. All the staff were very courteous and couldn't do enough for you! Especially Eva who use to meet us every morning at breakfast and chat about NYC and places to go . Lovely lady!! The hotel was just open two weeks I believe so a few teething problems like water leaking through shower door and lifts slightly slow. Made up by the lovely modern rooms really appealing and our room with a spectacular view of Empire State Building ! We were treated to free breakfast as the restaurant wasn't yet opened, very welcoming. About 15 minutes from Times Square to walk and 10 minutes to Chelsea.A great hotel!! Thoroughly recommend

My husband was staying here for business and I joined him, and we were both so impressed by the hotel. The lifts were a little slow but our room had a fabulous view of the Empire State Building and was well appointed. But my favorite thing was the gorgeous rooftop bar. As they had just opened they were giving free wine and beer, and also breakfast was included too. Hope it stays as great once it becomes more popular

review_body: Love the new Moxy Chelsea! Great location, awesome design and super friendly staff. The rooftop bar is incredible with views of the entire city. Rooms were also really comfortable with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building.

Location, atmosphere, awesome rooftop bar, crazy rooms this hotel has it all!Staff always friendly and ready to help you.Nice shower in the room whit great beds.I loved the led panel at the elevators!

#hotelnerdalert love everything about this room, from the functionality, the bedtime stories button, to the bulldog bottle opener and catcher. All 200 sqft couldn’t have been better designed. Keneisha in the lobby is also my spirit animal. #wanderlust #mughesodysseys

I stayed at the Moxy Chelsea with my two young kids and husband and we had such a lovely time! The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and the staff was very welcoming and friendly throughout our whole stay. We loved the design of the hotel- and everything was impeccably CLEAN! Which was a big plus since we were traveling with a toddler and an 8 month old. Our room had a view of the Empire State Building and we all got a great night sleep on the comfy beds! My only regret is that I wish we were able to stay longer!

My wife and I came in from NJ to see Interpol perform at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night. Before we get to the hotel, I must say the proximity to MSG was huge, about a 4 minute walk to get to the event. No taxis, uber or traffic, just a stones throw away, which was so easy and convenient.Danny checked us in and was he was very delightful and funny. The hotel has a real modern, trendy feel to it. We stayed on the 24th floor and the view of Manhattan was stunning with floor to ceiling windows. The rooftop bar has a pretty trendy vibe to it. We had a couple of quick drinks there before heading to the show as well as breakfast up there, and it offered another perspective of the Manhattan skyline. The experience was really nice from top to bottom, and again, if you're coming in to NYC to see a show at the Garden, it's a no-brainer.

I originally contacted Angel Medina at Moxy Chelsea to inquire about the hotel location and nearby attractions. My interaction with him was above and beyond my expectation as he was extremely helpful. He asked questions about my visit to New York and I informed him that we were celebrating my boyfriend’s birthday. He gave me several suggestions of things to do and places to eat nearby. He took time to learn my needs and treated me like a “valued customer”. He stated that he would see what he could to make our visit special for my boyfriend’s birthday celebration. When we arrived to check in on Friday morning, we were greeted by a bunch of smiling faces - Angel, Marvin, Keneisha, Claudia and Tiffani. They all knew who we were on a first name basis and said they were expecting our arrival. The greeting alone made my boyfriend and I feel special and welcomed. Throughout our stay the staff did whatever they could to accommodate us and ensure we were comfortable. Our room was amazing! They decorated our bathroom mirror with Christmas lights and a personalized birthday message for my boyfriend. They put us on the 27th floor with an AMAZING view of the city! It was a perfect start to our weekend. Everything in our room was posh, chic and SOOO “New York”!!! Whenever we entered and exited the hotel we were greeted with a smile and someone on the staff was always asking how our stay was going, or if we needed anything — from the concierge at the front door, to housekeeping, to the gentlemen riding the elevators at night; there was always a genuine concern that everything was good! Saying goodbye felt like we were leaving our new found family! The staff said we would be missed which is exactly how my boyfriend and I both felt about them! With all the traveling we both do in our corporate careers (and for pleasure), it is rare to find a quality hotel with top notch service at a reasonable price. Staying at Moxy was a 5-Star experience that we’ll never forget! We will definitely return to this location for our next visit to the city!!!

The hotel staff was amazing! I was greeted by a staff member who opened the door for me and a front desk agent who was extremely sweet and helpful. Housekeeping, and the housemen were prompt with our requests as well. Sean Johnston is a huge asset to the team and made our stay a 15/10! The rooftop bar has the best views of the Empire State Building and the overall ambiance is phenomenal!

I have heard mixed reviews about the Moxy Hotels. New York was selling out of a lot of hotels on the weekend we traveled and this Moxy was brand new and offering pretty decent rates so I tried it out. I have to recommend this place to travelers. My wife and I were given a room on the 30th floor with a view of Southern Manhattan. The view was Amazing and you can see well past downtown Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty from the room we were in. The rooms are small but comfortable beds and the shower is legit. Great experience here and the staff were all very friendly.

I stayed here with my husband and family. Very nice hotel. Modern and contemporary. Extremely helpful and friendly “crew”. We were greeted by everyone in the entrance lobby, not just one person. They took care of our car and we checked in early without any problems.Both rooms were very comfortable and unique. Not your typical hotel room. Love the peg board concept for hanging clothes and the under bed drawers for storage.We were offered free wine and beer on the rooftop bar as well as free breakfast in the morning. Overall great stay and will most definitely return.

This hotel is amazing. Will definitely be back. Captain is ARRRGGHright... no, he was AMAZING. It was a wonderful\ experience for a quick business trip. Definitely visit the rooftop for a fantastic view of New York.

review_body: We were excited to try the new Moxy Chelsea, as We had enjoyed our other trips to The other Moxy in Times Square. It’s in the heart of the Flower District and you walk through this really beautiful flower shop to get into the hotel. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help us throughout our Valentines Day celebration. The windows were HUGE with incredible nyc views. Bed was super comfortable, and the rain shower was fabulous. Very clean and modern rooms. The restaurants weren’t yet open but they had a nice hosted wine hour and breakfast on the rooftop lounge. The lounge was STUNNING. We will certainly be back!
